0.title: 'NTR31' to go on floors by April 2023, director Prashanth Neel confirms
0.article_body: Director Prashanth Neel has confirmed that his upcoming film with Jr NTR, tentatively titled 'NTR31', will go on the floors by April 2023. The 'KGF 2' director, who called himself a fan of NTR, said he had met the actor 10-15 times to "understand him a little more". However, he refused to share any other details about the film.

1.title: Prabhas' 'Salaar' to release on Sept 28, 2023; will compete with Hrithik's 'Fighter'
1.article_body: The makers of 'Salaar' have announced the release date of the Prabhas starrer. The Prashanth Neel directorial will release on September 28, 2023. The film will be competing at the box office with Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone's 'Fighter', which is set to release on the same date. 'Fighter', directed by Siddharth Anand, marks Hrithik and Deepika's first film together.

2.title: Feel protective about you as much as my twins: Johar on Ayan's b'day
2.article_body: Director Karan Johar on Monday penned a birthday note for Ayan Mukerji in which he praised the director's hard work and commitment to his dream project, 'Brahmastra'. Johar said he feels protective of Ayan just like he does for his twins, Yash and Roohi. He said while no one can predict Brahmastra's box-office journey, Ayan is already a winner.

3.title: Attempts were made to forget Ambedkar, Lal Bahadur Shastri: K'taka CM
3.article_body: Amid controversy over excluding first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in the Karnataka government's newspaper advertisement on freedom fighters, CM Basavaraj Bommai said that attempts have been made to forget icons BR Ambedkar and Lal Bahadur Shastri. "If any Prime Minister had thought about making known the contributions of various PMs to the country, it is Narendra Modi," Bommai said.

4.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoists national flag in Lucknow
4.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoisted the Tricolour in Lucknow on the occasion of the 76th Independence Day and appreciated PM Modi's call for 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' programme. "PM Modi has made the Amrit Mahotsav programme of independence a national festival by connecting it with the common man...Today’s occasion is extremely important for all of us," said the CM.

5.title: TN govt to use AI surveillance to prevent elephant deaths due to train accidents
5.article_body: Tamil Nadu's forest department is planning to set up an artificial intelligence (AI) system to prevent elephant deaths due to train-related incidents on tracks between Madukkarai and Walayar in Coimbatore. The 150-metre area around the tracks will be divided into red, orange and yellow zones. Concerned authorities will be automatically alerted if an elephant enters any of the zones.

6.title: Disgusting, fans need to show respect: Kyrgios on fans calling Medvedev 'loser'
6.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has criticised fans after a video emerged on social media which shows a group of fans chanting "loser" towards world number one Daniil Medvedev. "Disgusting behaviour. This is the best we have in the sport, fans need to show some respect," tweeted Kyrgios. The incident happened after Medvedev lost to Kyrgios at the Canadian Open.

7.title: Centre begins process to auction additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum
7.article_body: Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has started the process to auction off an additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum after recently completing the sale of ₹1.5 lakh crore worth of airwaves. DoT has formed an internal committee to formulate a plan to include 37.0-42.5 GHz as international mobile telecommunications (IMT) bands. IMT is useful in offering 5G fixed wireless access services.

8.title: Zoom installer's macOS version can give attackers root access: Security expert
8.article_body: macOS version of Zoom installer can be used by attackers to gain root access to Mac, according to security specialist Patrick Wardle. Zoom's updater function installs update packages after checking if it has been cryptographically signed by Zoom. According to Wardle, attackers can substitute the update package with any malware program by keeping its name same as Zoom's signing certificate.

9.title: Tricolour hoisted at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan for 1st time
9.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, the Indian flag was hoisted at the Idgah Maidan in Bengaluru by revenue department officials on Monday morning amid tight security. This is the first time that the Indian flag was hoisted at the site. The flag hoisting was followed by the singing of the national anthem and the state anthem, reports said.

10.title: It's stupid to ignore 'Bazball': Sam Billings on Elgar's 'it has no longevity' comment
10.article_body: Responding to SA Test captain Dean Elgar's comment that England's 'Bazball' approach in Test cricket has no "longevity", England wicketkeeper-batter Sam Billings said, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." Billings also referred to England Lions' win in the four-day practice match against South Africa and said it was a "wake-up call" for the Dean Elgar-led side.

11.title: French Prez Emmanuel Macron tweets in Hindi to wish Indians on Independence Day
11.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday tweeted in Hindi to wish Indians on 75 years of Independence. He wrote, "Dear friend Narendra Modi, dear people of India, congratulations on your Independence Day!" Macron added, "As you proudly celebrate India's stunning achievements in the past 75 years, you can count on France to always stand by your side."

12.title: Artistes make human image of India's map at Red Fort, PM Modi takes a walk; video viral
12.article_body: A video has gone viral showing young artistes forming a human image of the map of India at Red Fort during the Independence Day celebrations. In the video, PM Narendra Modi can be seen taking a walk and meeting the children and acknowledging their efforts. Another video showed PM Modi asking artistes from Punjab to do 'bhangra'.

13.title: Facebook missed Brazil polls-related misinformation in ads: Report
13.article_body: According to a report by London-based non-profit firm Global Witness, Facebook failed to detect election-related misinformation in ads ahead of the 2022 election in Brazil. The ads, which were approved by Facebook but never released, contained wrong election date and incorrect voting methods. In a statement, Meta said it has prepared extensively and launched tools to promote reliable information.

14.title: India rightfully enjoys high prestige globally: Putin on 76th I-Day
14.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday congratulated India on the occasion of its 76th Independence Day, stating that India "rightfully enjoys high prestige on the world stage". "India’s achievements in the economic, social and other fields are widely acknowledged...[India] plays an important role in resolving topical issues on the international agenda," Putin said in a message.

15.title: Congratulations to Indian people on 75 yrs of Independence: UK PM
15.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted in both Hindi and English as he congratulated Indian people on 75 years of Independence on Monday. He said that during his visit to Gujarat and New Delhi, he'd seen the "thriving Living Bridge" between UK and India. "I look forward to seeing these bonds go from strength to strength in...next 75 years," he added.

16.title: Central government is hurting federal values: Telangana CM KCR
16.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that the present central government is hurting the federal values. "It is indulging in conspiracies that weaken the states financially as if cutting the branch on which one is seated," Rao added. The Union government which talks about the ideals of cooperative federalism is, in reality, indulging in the centralisation of powers, Rao added.

17.title: Philippines looks to buy US helicopters after scrapping Russia deal
17.article_body: The Philippines is in talks with the US to buy Chinook helicopters after scrapping a $227.35 million deal with Russia for 16 Mi-17 military helicopters, Manila's ambassador said. The ambassador said the decision has been taken to avoid sanctions from the west. The US is willing to strike a deal with the Philippines of the same amount including maintenance.

18.title: Bharat Biotech completes phase 3 trial of intranasal COVID vaccine
18.article_body: Bharat Biotech on Monday said it has completed clinical development for phase 3 trials and booster doses for the BBV154 (Covaxin) intranasal COVID-19 vaccine. Bharat Biotech International Limited announced that BBV154 has proven to be safe, well-tolerated and immunogenic in subjects in controlled clinical trials. It has been specifically formulated to allow intranasal delivery.

19.title: DMK's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma's ideals: TN CM on I-Day
19.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin in his Independence Day address at Fort St George in Chennai earlier today said that the DMK regime's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma Gandhi's ideals of secularism and brotherhood. "Mahatma Gandhi epitomised all lofty humanitarian principles...and he is among the great national symbols that should be reminded often to people," Stalin said after unfurling the tricolour.

20.title: Man falls to death from terrace while raising flag in Bengaluru
20.article_body: A 33-year-old software engineer died on Sunday after falling from a second-floor terrace while trying to raise the national flag in Bengaluru's Hennur area, as per media reports. The man, identified as Vishwas Kumar, reportedly climbed the terrace wall to raise the flag at his home but slipped from there. Kumar is survived by his wife and a two-year-old daughter.

21.title: India hands over Dornier surveillance aircraft to Sri Lanka Navy
21.article_body: Indian High Commissioner in Colombo Gopal Baglay along with Vice Chief of Indian Navy Vice Admiral SN Ghormade handed over a Dornier maritime surveillance aircraft to the Sri Lanka Navy in Katunayake on Monday. This comes as India celebrates its 76th Independence Day. "Security of India and Sri Lanka is enhanced by mutual understanding, mutual trust and cooperation," Baglay said.

22.title: Morrison took on secret ministerial roles during COVID: Australian PM
22.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese sought legal advice after reports emerged that his predecessor Scott Morrison was secretly appointed to key ministerial roles, duplicating some portfolios during the pandemic. The Governor-General's office told Reuters that the appointments were valid under the constitution. However, Albanese accused Morrison of centralising power.

23.title: Freedom doesn't come without price: Urvashi Rautela on Independence Day
23.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela, speaking on the occasion of Independence Day, has said, "A big salute to all the soldiers who sacrificed their lives for our independence!" The actress further said that people should not let anything divide the idea of India. "Freedom does not come without a price, and neither did ours," she added.

24.title: Trial for drone-based healthcare services launched in Arunachal
24.article_body: A trial to use drones to provide healthcare services to tribal and rural communities in an Arunachal Pradesh town was launched on Monday. According to a press release, the healthcare drone pilots are a result of the state's partnership with the World Economic Forum's 'Medicine from the Sky' (MFTS) initiative. The drone network will serve the people of East Kameng.

25.title: 6 ancient wells restored at Hyderabad's Qutub Shahi Tombs
25.article_body: The Aga Khan Trust for Culture restored six historical wells situated at Golconda's Qutub Shahi Tombs compound to its past glory, Special Chief Secretary of Urban Administration Arvind Kumar said. The wells were in an extremely dilapidated condition and had turned almost into water puddle. After restoration, there is a total of 19.3 million litres of water in these wells.

26.title: Owaisi brothers hoist national flag in Hyderabad
26.article_body: AIMIM leaders Asaduddin Owaisi and Akbaruddin Owaisi hoisted the national flag in Hyderabad on the occasion of country's 76th Independence Day. The Tricolour was hoisted at Madina Circle near Charminar. "Our ancestors fought against British but they also fought for an India that was free from hunger, exploitation and tyranny. We must take their struggle forward," the Hyderabad MP said.

27.title: Iran reacts to attack on Rushdie, says he 'crossed red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims'
27.article_body: Iran's foreign ministry on Monday said no one has the right to level accusations against Iran over the attack on Salman Rushdie. "We do not consider anyone other than himself and his supporters worthy of...reproach and condemnation," Iran said. Rushdie "exposed himself to popular outrage by insulting Islamic sanctities and crossing the red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims," Iran added.

28.title: Traffic to stop in Hyd for mass singing of national anthem on Aug 16
28.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday announced that traffic will come to a halt at all signalised and manned traffic junctions across the city for the mass singing of national anthem on August 16. All traffic signals will turn red at 11:30 am on Tuesday, police said. Police further urged commuters to stand and sing the national anthem at the junctions.

29.title: Man detained after Mukesh Ambani and his family receive death threats: Police
29.article_body: A suspect has been detained in Dahisar for issuing death threats to Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, Mumbai Police said. The man, who was identified as Afzal, allegedly made several threat calls on the display number of the Reliance Foundation Hospital on Monday morning. A case was registered after the hospital filed a complaint about the calls.

30.title: Haryana govt forms Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi
30.article_body: The municipalities of Pataudi and Haileymandi in Haryana have been merged and will now be operational as the Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi. Apart from having 10 adjoining villages, including Nerhera, Janola, Mirzapur and Mubarkpur, the newly-formed council is likely to have 32-35 wards. Notably, Haileymandi was named after an English governor named Malcolm Hailey.

31.title: Man claiming to be from Syria cheats Mumbai woman of ₹15 lakh
31.article_body: A 24-year-old technician from Mumbai lost ₹15 lakh in a 'customs clearance' fraud for claiming gifts sent by a man who claimed to be from Syria, police said on Sunday. The accused contacted the woman on Instagram and told her he would send his savings to her, for which she would need to pay customs charges, a police official said.

32.title: PM Modi let nation down by not discussing unfulfilled promises: Pawan Khera
32.article_body: Congress’ Pawan Khera said PM Narendra Modi has let the country down by not discussing the promises made by him in the last eight years and by not giving an account of his tenure. Khera's statement came following PM's Independence Day address. "His words sound tiring...his own words on promises made are troubling him now," Khera added.

33.title: Youth from tier-2, tier-3 cities behind success of startups: PM
33.article_body: During his ninth successive Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the success of digital and startup developments has been made possible by the youth of India's tier-2 and tier-3 cities. PM Modi mentioned that the country is moving towards 5G era. He also called India an aspirational society which is the biggest asset for any nation.

34.title: Man slits 22-yr-old pregnant girlfriend's throat over dispute in Thane
34.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly slitting the throat of his 22-year-old pregnant girlfriend in Thane. During the investigation, it was found that the two had some issues arising from their relationship, said API Krupali Borse of the Mumbra police station. The accused wanted to get rid of the victim and killed her by slitting her throat, Borse said.

35.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man who tried to stab officers
35.article_body: Israeli police have said that security forces shot dead a Palestinian man who tried to stab officers during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Monday. The officers were conducting a raid at a house, police added. The deceased man's father claimed that his son wasn't armed and that the Israeli officers "immediately began shooting" on entering the house.

36.title: Stop reckless driving, illegal parking: Pune Traffic Police to PMPML
36.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police have written to the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) to instruct their drivers to stop reckless driving at the Katraj chowk, adding that the drivers shouldn't illegally park their vehicles. "Action should be taken involved in rash driving. At Katraj stand, the drivers do not wait for passengers to board the bus," a commuter said.

37.title: US man drives vehicle through crowd leaving 1 dead, later kills mother
37.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly drove a vehicle through a crowd at a fundraiser event in Columbia County in US' Pennsylvania, then went home and killed his mother, police said. One person was killed and 17 others were injured in the incident at the fundraiser event, police added. The fundraiser was for victims of a house fire.

38.title: Stoinis accuses Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking, sparks controversy after video goes viral
38.article_body: Southern Brave's Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis accused Oval Invincibles' Pakistani pacer Muhammad Hasnain of chucking after the latter dismissed him. A video went viral showing Stoinis implying the 22-year-old's bowling action was illegal by miming a chucking motion. "Downright disgusting," a user tweeted. "How about sticking to playing...and letting officials do their job," wrote another.

39.title: Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world: Preity
39.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram and wished her fans on the occasion of Independence Day. Preity shared pictures of herself and her twin babies with the national flag. Along with the pictures, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world from the three of us." Preity welcomed the twins in November 2021 through surrogacy.

40.title: Sonali Bendre celebrates Independence Day in Atlanta, shares pics
40.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre took to Instagram and shared pictures of her celebrations of India's Independence Day in Atlanta, United States. Along with the pictures, Sonali wrote, "Took a little bit of home to Atlanta." In the pictures, the actress can be seen waving the Indian national flag with several other Indians. Sonali recently featured in the OTT series 'Broken News'.

41.title: Indian fans love cricket: Mandhana on 'Women's IPL is coming' question
41.article_body: India Women batter Smriti Mandhana, who's currently playing in The Hundred women's tournament, was asked, "With the Women's IPL coming next year, can we expect the same kind of enthusiasm back in India as well?" Mandhana replied, "Indian fans love cricket and they turn up to support us regardless of whether it is a one-day or T20."

42.title: Not fair if we play 6 Tests in a year and India, Aus, Eng play 15: Anrich Nortje
42.article_body: South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje has said it's not fair that India, England and Australia are playing more Tests than them. "If we play six in a year and [they] play 15 in a year, I don't see that being fair. Our guys are not going to be as well-known...if we play 18 games in three years," he stated.

43.title: Gangster with ₹50,000 bounty arrested after shootout in Delhi
43.article_body: A 48-year-old gangster was arrested on Sunday following a brief shootout in southwest Delhi's Ghitorni village, officials said. The gangster, identified as Parveen Yadav, had a bounty of ₹50,000 over a case of shootout-cum-murder of a law student in Rohini in 2021, police said. Yadav was wanted in nearly 20 crime cases, including cases of extortion and assault, police added.

44.title: CM Bhagwant Mann announces setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in Punjab
44.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann has announced the setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in the state. The Chief Minister also praised youths from the state serving in Indian Army and said, "Every village of Punjab has...a memorial of martyrs who had fought for independence...Punjabi youths serving the Indian army are protecting the borders."

45.title: Pune woman completes 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali
45.article_body: Pune resident Preeti Maske has completed a 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali in a little over 118 hours, Border Roads Organisation (BRO) said in a tweet on Monday. "Daunting was the challenge, determined was Preeti," BRO's tweet further said. Maske had earlier set a Guinness World Record in June by cycling alone from Leh to Manali.

46.title: I-Day celebrations affect traffic movement on several roads in Delhi
46.article_body: The Independence Day celebrations led to vehicular traffic on several roads in Delhi on Monday. All Delhi borders have been closed due to security reasons, following which heavy traffic was reported on the DND flyover, Barapullah, Tikri border, Jharoda and Apsara Road. An additional police force was deployed in New Delhi, North Delhi and at the borders.

47.title: CR to add 10 additional AC local services in Mumbai division
47.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) will soon be adding 10 more air-conditioned (AC) local trains in Mumbai division, CPRO of CR said. Currently, there are 56 AC local services, with the 10 additional, total number of services will be 66. "The AC local is gaining popularity and it's evident by the sale of daily tickets," a CR official said.

48.title: What is DigiYatra app, the contactless passenger processing system for airports?
48.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited launched a beta version of the DigiYatra app, a passenger processing system based on facial recognition technology, at Terminal 3. After users download the app, they can pass through the airport's various checkpoints with paperless and contactless processing while their facial features will establish their identities, linking them to their boarding passes.

49.title: Thousands laid down their lives so India breathes this day: Sreejesh on I-Day
49.article_body: Indian men's hockey team goalkeeper PR Sreejesh took to Twitter on the occasion of 76th Independence Day and wrote, "Thousands laid down their lives so that our country breathes this day. Never forget their sacrifice." Commonwealth Games 2022 para table tennis gold medallist Bhavina Patel tweeted, "May our Tiranga always fly the highest. Wishing everyone a Happy Independence Day."

50.title: Won't make a comment on these things: Rahul on PM's nepotism remark
50.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi reacted to the 'Parivaarvaad' remark made by PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech on Monday. "I won't make a comment on these things. Happy Independence to everyone," he said. PM Modi had said that two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'Parivaarvaad' or nepotism.

51.title: Man hides gold worth ₹13 lakh in underwear, caught at Hyd airport
51.article_body: Customs officials seized four gold bars, weighing 258.29 grams valued at ₹13,63,771, from a passenger who arrived at the Hyderabad airport from Dammam on Sunday morning. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold bars by concealing them in a customised brief. Another passenger was arrested for trying to smuggle 154 grams of gold.

52.title: Holland takes break from social media, says 'I find it overstimulating'
52.article_body: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' actor Tom Holland took to Instagram to announce a break from social media platforms. "I find Instagram and Twitter to be overstimulating, to be overwhelming," Holland said in the video. "I get caught up and I spiral when I read things about me online and ultimately it's very detrimental to my mental state," he added.

53.title: Tricolour will fly high when every Indian has access to good healthcare: Kejriwal
53.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said education and health are key to becoming a rich country. "Tricolour will fly high only when every Indian has access to good healthcare," Kejriwal added. Furthermore, he said, "A poor man's child can dream of becoming lawyer, engineer in Delhi because of education revolution here."

54.title: My grandparents would tell me horrifying stories of partition: Asees
54.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur has said that she was "really lucky" that she was born in free India. "My grandparents would tell us horrifying tales of Partition. I know their stories, struggles and all the hardships that they have gone through," she further added. Asees revealed she began singing when she was a five-year-old and added she sang all patriotic songs.

55.title: Taliban declares national holiday to mark 1 yr since return to power
55.article_body: Taliban has declared a national holiday on Monday to mark the first anniversary of its return to power in Afghanistan. "We fulfilled...obligation of jihad and liberated our country," a fighter who'd stormed Kabul during Taliban's takeover said. Thousands of people had rushed to Kabul airport as they tried to escape from Afghanistan after the Taliban's takeover on August 15, 2021.

56.title: Dropping Nehru's image in govt ad deliberate: Karnataka BJP leader
56.article_body: Karnataka BJP General Secretary and MLC Ravikumar on Monday said dropping Jawaharlal Nehru's image from the government advertisement for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign was a "deliberate" act. "[Mahatma] Gandhiji had said that Congress should be dissolved after independence. However, Nehru didn't dissolve Congress. Due to all these reasons, we have dropped his picture from the ad," Ravikumar said.

57.title: Faridabad Police arrest 3 men for cheating people online
57.article_body: Three men were arrested by Faridabad Police for allegedly cheating people online. The suspects, Akshay, Darshan Bhai, and Sagar, assured high returns to the victims on conducting online business from home, police said. Notably, police have found transactions worth ₹47 crore in their bank accounts and recovered ₹1.20 lakh cash, one mobile phone, and one ATM card from their possession.

58.title: China conducts more drills near Taiwan amid US lawmakers' visit
58.article_body: Chinese military said they carried out more military drills near Taiwan on Monday. The step comes at a time when a group of US lawmakers visited Taiwan and met President Tsai Ing-wen. The People's Liberation Army's Eastern Theatre Command said the exercises were a stern deterrent to the US and Taiwan who continue to play political tricks.

59.title: After breaking up with Shakira, Gerard Pique dating 23-year-old PR student: Reports
59.article_body: After breaking up with singer Shakira, Barcelona footballer Gerard Pique is dating a 23-year-old PR student named Clara Chia Marti, as per reports. “Gerard and Clara have been seeing each other for months. She is a student who also works for him in his office, organising events," a source said. Pique and Shakira had announced their break-up in June.

60.title: Martin Guptill breaks Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket
60.article_body: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill has broken Team India captain Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket. With his 15-run knock in the third T20I against West Indies, Guptill took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 3,497, overtaking Rohit, who has scored 3,487 runs. Virat Kohli is third on the list, with 3,308 runs.

61.title: PayNearby launches 'zero investment plan' for rural women
61.article_body: Fintech startup PayNearby launched a 'zero investment plan' for women entrepreneurs across 20,000+ pin codes. To help rural women achieve financial independence, under this initiative, the firm will waive off opening fees for business account, which are otherwise charged at ₹1,000. Women partners, however, will be required to pay a bare minimum cost for the KYC completion.

62.title: PMC to construct 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi
62.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations along with its Solid Waste Management Department to build 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations this year. Along with these tanks, PMC will also construct over 130 fixed tanks for the idols' immersion across the city. The expenses for the fixed tanks have been approved, the civic body confirmed.

63.title: Rushdie's son releases statement, says his sense of humour remains intact after attack
63.article_body: Salman Rushdie's son Zafar has released his family's statement on his father's condition after the author was stabbed multiple times on Friday in New York. Zafar said his father remains in critical condition, adding, "Though his life-changing injuries are severe, his usual feisty and defiant sense of humour remains intact." Zafar thanked audience members who helped Rushdie after the attack.

64.title: President Droupadi Murmu pays tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi
64.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu paid tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi on Monday. News agency ANI reported that Army chief, General Manoj Pande, Indian Navy chief, Admiral R Hari Kumar and Indian Air Force chief, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari were also present. Pictures were shared on the official Twitter handle of President of India.

65.title: BJP will say we are distributing freebies: Tejashwi on Nitish's jobs announcement
65.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav reacted to CM Nitish Kumar's announcement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities and said that BJP will now say that we are distributing freebies. "I was saying from the beginning that we, and not BJP, will fulfil the promise...It's an achievement that today discussions are being held on employment," he added.

66.title: Catastrophe: German minister on mass die-off of fish in Oder river
66.article_body: German Environment Minister Steffi Lemke on Sunday called the mass die-off of fish in Oder river, which runs through Germany and Poland, an "ecological disaster". Lemke was addressing a press conference along with her Polish counterpart Anna Moskwa. Moskwa said that Oder river samples will be tested for about 300 potential substances and will also be sent to foreign laboratories.

67.title: I didn't expect it could happen again: Nadal on chance to become world no. 1
67.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal has said he didn't expect that he could again have the chance to become the world number one men's singles player. Nadal could become the top-ranked player if he wins the Cincinnati Open and Daniil Medvedev faces an early exit. "It means a lot to me to have [this] opportunity," added Nadal.

68.title: Maharashtra CM hoists Tricolour on 76th Independence Day
68.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde hoisted the Tricolour at the state secretariat on the country's 76th Independence Day. CM Shinde said that his government is committed to extend the reservation benefits to Other Backward Classes, Maratha and Dhangar communities. "We started working from day one and our priority is to work for the common man, farmers," he added.

69.title: Transparent selection without nepotism got India medals: PM Modi on CWG 2022
69.article_body: While addressing the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi stated that it is his constitutional duty to fight nepotism. Referring to the CWG 2022, he stated, "We saw in the recently concluded sports event we did well. It’s not that we didn’t have talent earlier...but transparent selection bereft of nepotism led to India scoring medals."

70.title: Will oppose misrepresentation of historical facts: Sonia Gandhi
70.article_body: While addressing the nation on the 76th Independence Day, Congress president Sonia Gandhi criticised the Centre and said the government is hell-bent on trivialising sacrifices of freedom fighters and their glorious achievements. “Congress will strongly oppose misrepresentation of historical facts for political gains and every attempt to put national leaders in the dock,” said Sonia.

71.title: Priyanka Gandhi, Rahul take part in Cong’s 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi
71.article_body: Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Rahul Gandhi on Monday took part in party's 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi on Independence Day. Party leaders Anand Sharma and Ghulam Nabi Azad also took part in the Yatra. "We should remember our martyrs, citizens and leaders who sacrificed their lives for independence and due to whom we are independent today," Priyanka said.

72.title: PM's 'bhai-batijawad' comment was likely on his own party: Congress
72.article_body: Congress reacted to PM Narendra Modi's 'bhai-batijawad' comment during his Independence Day address and said that it is likely an internal issue of the BJP. "Only PM Modi can clarify whether his attack was on his own ministers or their sons...But the country expected him to submit a report card of the last eight years," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

73.title: Domino's India responds after pics of mops hanging above pizza dough go viral
73.article_body: Domino's India responded after purported pictures of cleaning mops and a toilet brush hanging above trays of pizza dough at its outlet in Bengaluru went viral on Twitter. Domino's said that it has zero tolerance for violations of hygiene and food safety standards. "The incident...will be thoroughly investigated and basis the findings, appropriate measures will be rolled out," it added.

74.title: Indian-origin astronaut shares pics of Hyderabad from space, Tricolour at space station
74.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari shared pictures of the Tricolour at International Space Station and view of Hyderabad from space. "I'm reminded of Indian diaspora that I could see from [space station] where my immigrant father's home town of Hyderabad shines bright. [NASA] is just 1 place Indian-Americans make a difference every day," he tweeted.

75.title: Virat, Anushka join 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, pose with Tricolour at Mumbai home
75.article_body: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli wished the people on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day and displayed the Tricolour at their residence in Mumbai, joining Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "Celebrating 75 years of our Independence. Wishing all the Indians around the world a very Happy Independence Day. Jai Hind," Anushka wrote on Instagram.

76.title: Bihar CM announces 10 lakh jobs, 10 lakh additional employment opportunities on I-Day
76.article_body:
On the occasion of Independence Day, Bihar Chief Minister announced arrangement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities in the state. Taking to Twitter, Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav wrote, "Many thanks to respected Chief Minister Shri @NitishKumar
 ji for the historic announcement of arranging 10 lakh jobs and other 10 lakh [additional] jobs in Bihar."

77.title: 80 children die from measles amid outbreak in Zimbabwe: Report
77.article_body: Zimbabwe's health ministry has said that 80 children have died following a measles outbreak since April, which has now spread nationwide with a case fatality rate of 6.9%, according to a statement seen by Reuters. "[Church gatherings] which were attended by people from different provinces...with unknown vaccination status led to...spread of measles," the ministry's secretary said in a statement.

78.title: Man with knife can't silence man with pen: NY Guv on attack on Rushdie
78.article_body: New York State Governor Kathy Hochul has condemned the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying, "A man with a knife can't silence a man with a pen." Hochul made the remark during an address at Chautauqua Institution, where the attack took place. "New York State will always stand up to protect freedom of expression [and] freedom of speech," she added.

79.title: I'll remember this for life: Raducanu on facing Serena Williams at Cincinnati Open
79.article_body: The reigning US Open champion Emma Raducanu has said she's excited to play against Serena Williams for the first time in their first-round match at the Cincinnati Open. "It'll be an incredible experience...I'll surely remember [it] the rest of my life," said the 19-year-old. Williams will be playing her last WTA tournament before her retirement at the US Open.

80.title: Mukesh Ambani and his family receive threat calls, Mumbai Police begin probe
80.article_body: A complaint has been filed by the Reliance Foundation Hospital about receiving calls posing threat to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, ANI reported quoting Mumbai Police on Monday. As many as eight calls were received at the hospital, as per reports. Mumbai Police said that a case is being filed in this matter and investigation is underway.

81.title: Woman's 'You're a bomber' text to boyfriend leads to 6-hour delay in Mumbai flight
81.article_body: An IndiGo flight travelling from Mangaluru to Mumbai was delayed by six hours after a woman passenger alerted the cabin crew about a suspicious text message on a fellow traveller’s phone. The man was reportedly texting his girlfriend, who wrote to him 'You are a bomber'. The police later confirmed that it was a friendly chat between both of them.

82.title: Mukesh Ambani celebrates Independence Day with wife Nita, grandson Prithvi
82.article_body: A video showing Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani celebrating Independence Day with wife Nita Ambani and grandson Prithvi Ambani has surfaced online. The video shows AR Rahman's 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' playing in the background with several people holding the National Flags. His house Antilia was also lit up in Tricolour.

83.title: Mumbai banker wanting to get Fastag recharge loses ₹7 lakh in cyber-fraud
83.article_body: A 34-year-old Mumbai-based bank manager, who wanted to get her Fastag recharged, lost ₹7 lakh to cyber-fraudsters after calling a Fastag helpline number she found on internet. As per the complainant, the fraudsters took her vehicle details and sent a link to her. After clicking on the link, the victim logged into her bank's app and the money got deducted.

84.title: They call him 'Badshah of BSE', but he was a dreamer: Irani on Jhunjhunwala
84.article_body: Condoling the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "They call him a billionaire investor, the badshah of BSE...but what he really was...is and always will be...is a dreamer." In another tweet, Irani wrote, "Bhaiyya always told me 'apan apne dam par jeeyenge' (we will live on our own terms)...And he lived on his own terms."

85.title: BSF, Pakistan Rangers exchange sweets at Int’l Border in J&K on India’s I-Day
85.article_body: On the occasion of India’s 76th Independence Day, sweets were exchanged between the Border Security Force (BSF) troops and Pakistan Rangers at the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir’s RS Pura. "BSF has always been on the forefront in creating a peaceful and congenial atmosphere on border while dominating the border effectively," BSF said.

86.title: Let's take vow not to forget history: Kamal Haasan on Independence Day
86.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Kamal Haasan wished his fans on the occasion of Independence Day. "If you forget history, you'll have to return to the...same old days says history. Let us take a vow not to forget history," Kamal wrote in Tamil. He urged people to recall freedom fighters and Indian armed forces that enabled them to celebrate Independence Day.

87.title: Assam govt to withdraw 1 lakh minor cases to reduce burden on lower judiciary: CM
87.article_body: Assam government will withdraw one lakh minor cases, including those for social media posts to help reduce the burden on lower judiciary, state Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The announcement came during Independence Day celebrations in Guwahati. He said that the government has decided that minor cases registered before midnight of August 14, 2021, will be withdrawn.

88.title: Indian Navy hoist Tricolour across 6 continents, 3 oceans & 6 time zones; video surfaces
88.article_body: As part of the celebrations on 75 years of Independence, the Indian Navy have deployed warships to every continent except Antarctica. The Indian Navy warships hoisted the Tricolour across six continents, three oceans and six different time zones. The warships were deployed in Perth, Singapore, Muscat, Mombasa, London, Rio de Janeiro and San Diego.

89.title: 'Laal...' gives message of maintaining mutual brotherhood: Punjab CM Mann
89.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann took to Twitter and praised Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Today, I got a chance to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...the movie gives a message of maintaining mutual brotherhood...not letting the seeds of hatred grow in tender hearts," he tweeted. Mann further congratulated Aamir and his team. Mann's tweet comes amid the boycott calls against the film.

90.title: B'luru buildings light up with tri-coloured lights on I-Day, pics surface
90.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, several buildings in Bengaluru lit up in tri-coloured lights. Bengaluru MP PC Mohan shared picture of illuminated Vidhan Soudha. Meanwhile, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya shared video of NIMHANS Bengaluru "proudly lit with Tricolour glory". Pictures of Munireddypalya TV Tower and Sir M Visvesvaraya Baiyyappanahalli Railway terminal were also shared.

91.title: Bill Gates tweets on India's I-Day, praises PM Modi for prioritising healthcare
91.article_body:
The world’s fifth richest man and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates tweeted wishes on India's 76th Independence Day. He tweeted, "As India celebrates its Independence Day, I congratulate 
Narendra Modi for prioritising healthcare and digital transformation while spearheading India's development. India's progress in these sectors is inspiring and we are fortunate to partner in this journey."

92.title: Were told not to go to police, teacher paid ₹1.5 lakh: Raj dalit boy's uncle
92.article_body: Uncle of nine-year-old dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up by his school teacher for drinking water from the pot, said that the Rajputs told the family to reach a compromise and not go to the police. "The teacher gave us ₹1.5 lakh...in two instalments and said...he was ready to pay another lakh for...Indra's treatment," the uncle said.

93.title: 300 firefighters battle forest fire in Spain; 1,500 evacuated
93.article_body: About 1,500 people were evacuated on Sunday due to a raging forest fire in Spain's Zaragoza province as 300 firefighters battled the blaze. The regional head said that the forest fire had spread rapidly due to high winds and that the situation was "critical". The blaze had spread over a 50 km area within 24 hours, a forest chief said.

94.title: PM Modi releases pics of Independence Day celebration at Red Fort today
94.article_body: PM Narendra Modi shared pictures of the Independence Day celebration held at the Red Fort on Monday. PM Modi addressed the nation from the monument after hoisting the Tricolour and listed five resolves for the citizens for the next 25 years. The resolves include developing India, removing every ounce of slavery, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling duties.

95.title: Infosys is in stable position because of its founders: CEO Parekh
95.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh praised the company's founding members for building an "incredible organisation" and voiced confidence that the firm will continue to be stable. In an interview with PTI, Parekh said he believes that Infosys is "well-positioned" to leverage tech-led growth opportunities over the next several years. Infosys raised full-year revenue growth outlook to 14-16% for FY23.

96.title: Aug 5 to be celebrated as 'Freedom from Corruption' day every year in J&K: Sinha
96.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said the administration has decided that August 5 will be celebrated as "Freedom from Corruption" day every year. "Continuous drives against corruption will be done throughout the year," Sinha added. He took part in Independence Day celebrations in Srinagar on Monday. "In new J&K, ground of 21st century for realising dreams...of youth...being prepared," Sinha added.

97.title: CM Bommai participates in midnight flag hoisting event in Bengaluru
97.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took part in midnight flag hoisting and cultural program organised as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75th anniversary of India's independence at Bengaluru's Malleswaram Barangay. "PM Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign received an amazing response. We saw record participation from people across different walks of life," he said at the event.

98.title: Video of Spurs manager Conte, Chelsea boss Tuchel's heated argument viral
98.article_body: A video of Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte and Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel's heated argument after their sides played out a 2-2 draw has gone viral. When both managers came face to face after the match, they had to be separated by players. Conte and Tuchel had also confronted each other when Spurs had equalised the scoreline to 1-1.

99.title: Self-obsessed govt adamant to trivialise freedom fighters' sacrifices: Sonia Gandhi
99.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said today's "self-obsessed government" is adamant about "trivialising" sacrifices of freedom fighters and achievements of the country. "Congress will oppose wrong statements made on historical facts for political benefits...every attempt to question...national leaders like Gandhi, Nehru, Patel and Azad on basis of lies," she added.

100.title: PM Modi uses paper notes not teleprompter for his 82-min I-Day speech
100.article_body: PM Narendra Modi used paper notes and not a teleprompter, in his address to the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day. His speech lasted about 82 minutes and this marked his ninth address from the Red Fort. Among other things, PM Modi laid out a development strategy for India for the next 25 years in his speech.

101.title: 50th anniversary of independence wasn't packaged like this: Himachal CM
101.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur praised the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' initiative of his party to mark 75 years of India's independence and said, this is how Prime Minister Narendra Modi operates. Criticising the Congress government, he said, "The fiftieth year of independence had just passed us by like a routine (event). It wasn't packaged like this big event."

102.title: India's achievements in combating COVID-19 better than developed countries: Prez
102.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said India's achievements in combating COVID-19 pandemic have been better than those of many developed countries. "For this feat, we're grateful to our scientists, doctors...paramedics...staff associated with vaccination," she added. The government and policymakers deserve credit for "beating global trend and helping economy flourish" despite COVID-19 pandemic, she stated.

103.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoists national flag in Delhi
103.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoisted the tricolour at his residence in Delhi. Singh tweeted, “Unfurled the National Flag at my residence on the 75th anniversary of India’s Independence.” Singh asserted on Saturday that the government has put in place a flawless security system to ensure that no anti-India element can cast an evil eye on the sovereignty of the country.

104.title: Kerala Congress criticises PM Modi over ‘Parivarvaad’ remark
104.article_body: Kerala Congress criticised PM Modi for his remark on nepotism during his Independence Day speech. The party said, "We need to free the country from sangh parivarvaad. There's a real need to raise awareness against these corrupt termites in power who eat and sell whatever we've built as a country in the last 75 years!"

105.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat
105.article_body: PM Modi paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He also greeted people on the occasion. “Greetings on this very special Independence Day,” PM Modi said. The August 15 ceremony is significant this year as it marks the 75th anniversary of India's independence, with the government launching a host of exercises and programmes.

106.title: S Korean Prez calls for improved ties with Japan, peace with N Korea
106.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said South Korea must overcome historical disputes with Japan and achieve peace with North Korea to bolster stability. Yoon made the statement during a ceremony which marked Korean Liberation Day. The relations between South Korea and Japan strained over Korean accusations of wartime abuse like Japan forcing women to work in brothels for its military.

107.title: Necessary to add 'Jai Anusandhan' to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan': PM
107.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said there is necessity to make addition to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan' slogan. "We...remember Lal Bahadur Shastri ji's slogan of 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan'...Later, AB Vajpayee added 'Jai Vigyaan' to this slogan. Now, there is...necessity to add - 'Jai Anusandhan' (research & innovation). Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan aur Jai Anusandhan," he added.

108.title: BJP chief JP Nadda greets people on Independence Day
108.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda extended his wishes to all the countrymen on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He paid tributes to freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives. “Happy Independence Day to all. Tribute to the great revolutionaries and freedom fighters who dedicated their lives for the freedom of Mother Bharati. This country will always be indebted to you,” tweeted Nadda.

109.title: Taliban must allow girls to go to school: Former Afghan Prez Karzai
109.article_body: In an interview with DW News, former Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai said Taliban must allow girls to go to school and Afghan women will be educated to become engineers, doctors, journalists and parliamentarians. "There's no compromise, no way we will allow Afghan girls being denied education," Karzai added. Karzai called the manner of the US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan disgraceful.

110.title: Putin writes to Kim Jong-un, says Russia & North Korea will expand relations: Reports
110.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin wrote to North Korea's Kim Jong-un on liberation day of Korea and said the two countries will "expand the comprehensive and constructive bilateral relations with common efforts", North Korean state media reported. Putin said closer ties would be in both countries' interests and would help strengthen the security and stability of the Korean peninsula, it added.

111.title: Let us make India the strongest, most prosperous: Harbhajan, Hardik on I-Day
111.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya and former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to share their wishes on the occasion of Independence Day. Hardik shared pictures holding the National Flag and wrote, "To all my fellow Indians, happy Independence Day." Harbhajan said, "Let us make India the strongest and most prosperous with our collective efforts."

112.title: India is mother of democracy, has proved it has precious ability: PM on I-Day
112.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Independence Day speech on Monday, said that India is the mother of democracy and has proved that it has a precious ability. "In this fight for Independence, struggle has continued in every corner of India...In the last 75 years, those who have died for the country...should be remembered and praised today," he added.

113.title: India sees 14,917 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate rises to 7.52%
113.article_body: India has reported 14,917 new COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,17,508, while the daily positivity rate rose to 7.52%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,27,069.

114.title: Kartik to begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem...' in Gujarat next month: Report
114.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan will reportedly begin filming for his upcoming film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' in Gujarat from next month. As per the report, the shooting will take place in Ahmedabad and its outskirts. The film also features Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' co-star Kiara Advani. 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' will be directed by Sameer Vidwans.

115.title: Blast leaves 5 dead in Ecuador; govt blames organised crime
115.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 16 others were injured in an explosion that took place in Ecuador's port city of Guayaquil on Sunday, officials said. Following the incident, the country's government blamed the blast on organised crime, officials added. Ecuador's Interior Minister said that this is a "declaration of war" against the state by "organised crime mercenaries".

116.title: In pics: Monuments across India illuminated in Tricolour lights
116.article_body: Monuments and heritage buildings across India were illuminated in Tricolour lights on the eve of the Independence Day. The buildings in this collection include India Gate, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Gateway of India, Humayun's Tomb, Ghanta Ghar in Srinagar, Safdarjung Tomb, Sardar Sarovar Dam, Karnataka Vidhana Soudha, West Bengal Raj Bhavan, Metcalfe Hall and Victoria Memorial.

117.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2% across tenors from today, EMIs to go up
117.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all tenors, effective August 15. With the hike in rates, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. Several banks raised their lending rates after the RBI increased repo rate by 50 bps earlier this month.

118.title: Salman Khan wishes fans on Independence Day, shares pic with national flag
118.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram on the occasion of Independence Day and shared a picture of himself holding the Indian national flag. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Wishing everyone a very happy 75th Independence Day. Jai Hind." Actress Sara Ali Khan also wished her fans on Independence Day on Instagram Stories and shared a tricolour collage.

119.title: I'm just dreaming for more: Simona Halep after winning her 3rd Canadian Open
119.article_body: Ex-world number one Simona Halep defeated Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia in Toronto to win her third Canadian Open title. Simona, who won 6-3, 2-6, 6-3, will now be placed sixth in next week's world rankings. "When I started the year...I set the goal to be...[in the] top 10. And here I am...I'm just dreaming for more," said Halep.

120.title: 18% of almost 1 crore registered MSMEs are women-owned: Govt data
120.article_body: Women entrepreneurs own 18% of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) registered in the country, according to government data. The Minister of State for MSMEs, Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma, shared the data in the Rajya Sabha. As of August 3, 2022, 17,96,408 MSMEs were owned by women out of the total 99,58,903 MSMEs registered on the Udyam portal.

121.title: Pic shows snake 'camouflaging' with dry sticks; IFS officer asks 'what do you see'
121.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a picture of a snake camouflaging with dry sticks and leaves on what appeared to be a forest floor. "Camouflage level !! So what do you see? This snake is called as Mock Viper. Mildly venomous. See how good it is in camouflaging," the officer wrote with the picture.

122.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat hoists national flag at Nagpur headquarters
122.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat hoisted the national flag at the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, Maharashtra amid tight security. "Today is the day of pride and resolution. The country got freedom after a lot of struggle, it needs to be self-reliant," Bhagwat said while addressing the gathering. India will give message of peace to the world, he added.

123.title: Apple updated its policy to explicitly ban caste-based discrimination 2 years ago
123.article_body: Apple has confirmed that it updated its general employee conduct policy about two years ago to explicitly prohibit caste-based discrimination. The company added caste alongside existing categories such as race, religion, gender, age and ancestry. Apple reportedly updated its policy after Cisco was sued on behalf of a low-caste engineer who accused two higher-caste bosses of blocking his career.

124.title: We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India: PM Modi
124.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech at the Red Fort said, "We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India." He also asked Indians to take the pledge to work towards the development of India, to erase all forms of colonial baggage and to display pride in the heritage of the country.

125.title: Length of tenure doesn't matter, your contribution matters: Justice Lalit
125.article_body: Justice UU Lalit said that length of tenure doesn't matter, it's about one's contribution. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "The length of the tenure doesn't matter to me. Every person gets a different tenure in the institution and I believe it's your contribution that matters." "Whatever you may do has to be at the institutional level," he stated.

126.title: May we continue to grow & become stronger: Shilpa on Independence Day
126.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video on the occasion of Independence Day. Along with the video, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day. May we continue to grow and become stronger over the next 75 years to come." Shilpa, who recently featured in 'Nikamma', will next be seen in Rohit Shetty's directorial 'Indian Police Force'.

127.title: Didn't get help till 6 am, couldn't connect to police helpline: Mete's driver
127.article_body: Vinayak Mete's driver, Eknath Kadam, said they got delayed response after accident. "Accident took place at around 5 to 5:15 am...Till 6 am, we did not receive any kind of help except for a small tempo, driver of which stopped to help me. I was trying to call the police helpline number 100 but I could not connect," he said.

128.title: Taiwan thanks India, others for support amid tensions with China
128.article_body: Taiwan has expressed gratitude to India and other nations over their calls for exercising restrain and avoiding unilateral actions to change the status quo amid tensions with China. "Taiwan will continue to enhance its self-defence capabilities while maintaining close communication and coordination with the US, Japan and all other like-minded nations including India," it added.

129.title: boAt celebrates its ‘1 million Make In India milestone' of manufacturing
129.article_body: boAt celebrates the manufacturing of 1 million made-in-India units through its Rock'In India campaign. For this campaign, boAt collaborated with Mayur Jumani to bring out the music created using the symphony of factory sounds showcasing India's dedication to Make and Rock In India, it said, adding that it becomes the only brand in its category to achieve 1 million mark.

130.title: Corruption & nepotism are 2 big challenges we face today: PM Modi on Independence Day
130.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech said, "Two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'parivaarwaad' or nepotism." He said, "Corruption is hollowing the country like a termite, we've to fight it." He added, "We've to raise awareness against 'parivaarwaad' to realise the strength of our institutions, to take the country forward on the basis of merit."

131.title: In next 25 yrs, we'll build a tech hub better than Silicon Valley: Vedanta chief on I-Day
131.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day. He wrote, "This is India's moment...From start-ups to sports, our youth have surpassed the world’s expectations. In the next 25 years, we'll build the world's leading technology hub, even better than Silicon Valley. With disruptive technology, we'll soon transform ourselves into an Atmanirbhar Bharat."

132.title: Youth in India is brimming with potential & highly motivated: Kartik Aaryan
132.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said the current generation of India wants opportunities from the country. "The youth in India...is brimming with potential, equipped with an advanced skill set and above all hardworking to the core," he stated. "They're highly motivated, ambitious with a go-getter attitude," he added. Kartik said with the right opportunities, there's nothing youth in India can't do.

133.title: BEST's ₹1 travel plan extended till August 31 in Mumbai
133.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) announced that it will extend its 'freedom plan' for Mumbaikars till August 31. "Around one lakh Mumbaikars used ₹1 BEST freedom plan in the last 12 days," said a BEST official. The plan, which was launched on August 1, allows commuters to travel by BEST buses to any location by paying ₹1.

134.title: I feel Shubman is being groomed as opener for 2023 ODI World Cup:
134.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said KL Rahul should open India's innings in the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe. "Rahul needs to get a lot of batting time...[But] I think it'll be a short-term arrangement as Shubman, I feel, is being groomed as opener for the ODI World Cup," he stated. Rahul hasn't played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022.

135.title: People of India want positive changes at quick pace: PM Modi
135.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said an aspirational society is an asset to any country. "We're proud that today in every corner of India aspirations are high," PM Modi added. "The people of India want positive changes...they want it at a quick pace. They also want to contribute towards it," he stated.

136.title: US Prez releases statement on I-Day, says, 'India & US are indispensable partners'
136.article_body: US President Joe Biden has released a statement extending wishes to India on Independence Day, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honor its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." "India and the United States are indispensable partners...Our partnership is further strengthened by the deep bonds between our people," he added.

137.title: Man crashes car, fires shots in air then kills self near US Capitol
137.article_body: A 29-year-old man shot himself dead after crashing his car into a barricade and firing shots into the air near the US Capitol on Sunday, police said. Following the crash, the car became engulfed in flames as the man got out, the police added. "At this time, it doesn't appear...man was targeting any members of Congress," police further said.

138.title: Woman accidentally becomes owner of 84 US houses instead of 1 after typo
138.article_body: A woman accidentally became the legal owner of an entire neighbourhood of 84 homes in the US after a typo error caused these properties to be included with the house that she bought. While she paid $594,481 for the property, faulty documents revealed that her purchase included an extra 84 properties and two common spaces estimated at around $50 million.

139.title: We don't think on those lines: Pant on competition with Karthik for T20 WC spot
139.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the competition with Dinesh Karthik for a spot in India's playing XI in the upcoming T20 World Cup, said, "We don't think on those lines." He added, "[It] depends on the coach and the captain." Both Karthik and Pant have been named in the squad for the Asia Cup.

140.title: Our daughters are biggest hope for nation: President Murmu
140.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that in most other well-established democracies, women had to wage long-drawn struggles to get the right to vote but India can be credited to have helped the world discover the true potential of democracy. "Our daughters are the biggest hope for the nation," President Murmu said on Sunday. Gender inequalities have reduced in India, she stated.

141.title: Pune signal waiting time increased from 90-120 seconds to 150-180 seconds
141.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police Department has extended signal waiting times at main chowks of the city to decongest and monitor traffic jams, reports said. The waiting time which was 90 to 120 seconds has now increased to 150 to 180 seconds. "The number of vehicles has increased...and so we need to keep finding ways to manage traffic," police said.

142.title: After 75 years, we've heard the sound of Made-in-India weapon in I-Day gun salute: PM Modi
142.article_body: During his Independence Day speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "After 75 years, we've heard the sound of a Made-in-India weapon in the Independence Day gun salute. I salute the Armed Forces for this feat." For the first time, a home-grown howitzer gun, Advanced Towed Artillery Gun System (ATAGS), was used for the 21-gun salute during the ceremony at Red Fort.

143.title: Vicky's 'Uri..' name inspired by Hrithik's in Lakshya, had same surname: Dhar
143.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Dhar said he loves the movie 'Lakshya' and that actor Vicky Kaushal's name in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' was inspired by actor Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya'. "Vicky's name in [Uri: The Surgical Strike] is...Vihaan Singh Shergill...[it] was inspired from Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya', which was...Karan Shergill," he said, adding that it was his tribute to 'Lakshya'.

144.title: US Congressional delegation visits Taiwan amid tensions with China
144.article_body: A five-member US Congressional delegation arrived in Taiwan on Sunday for a two-day visit amid tensions with China. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan earlier this month. Taiwan's Foreign Affairs Ministry shared pictures of the lawmakers' arrival on Twitter and said, "We thank the like-minded US lawmakers for the timely visit and unwavering support."

145.title: Issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels: Justice Lalit
145.article_body: The issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels, Justice UU Lalit said. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "When a criminal appeal remains pending in SC, it gives rise to tertiary litigation...One pending matter will beget more cases at different levels. Therefore, need is to tackle the one pending before the SC at the earliest."

146.title: He planned smooth transition to sustain his legacy: Jhunjhunwala's stock trading firm
146.article_body: Rare Enterprises, the stock trading company owned by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, issued a statement after the demise of the billionaire investor. "True to his nature...he had planned and...executed a smooth transition to sustain and enhance his legacy," the firm said. Calling him a "true nationalist", it added, "His unwavering belief in Indian entrepreneurs and enterprise will certainly outlive him."

147.title: Hyderabad to face 36-hour water supply shutdown from Aug 16
147.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) said that over 3.5 lakh residents under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits will be affected by the disruption of water supply for 36 hours starting August 16. The water supply will be hit for completing electric work and flyover construction being undertaken as part of Strategic Road Development Project.

148.title: I have 1 request to all Indians, change the mentality towards our women: PM Modi
148.article_body: During his address at Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "I have one request to every Indian. Can we change the mentality towards our women in everyday life?" Adding that respect for women is an important pillar for India's growth, he stated, "Pride of Nari Shakti will play a vital role in fulfilling the dreams of India."

149.title: 2 women, 5 men pose as Mumbai Police in Delhi, rob wellness company; held
149.article_body: Two women and five men were arrested for allegedly posing as Mumbai Police personnel in Delhi and robbing a wellness company on August 10. "All of them were wearing Mumbai Police identity cards around their necks...They collected the employees' mobile phones and forced Yadav [owner of company] at gunpoint to call his wife and ask for the money," police added.

150.title: India needs to be a developed nation in next 25 years: PM Modi on Independence Day
150.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that India needs to be a developed nation in the next 25 years. "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years of their lives for the development of the nation. We will work towards even the development of the entire humanity," he added.

151.title: Jhunjhunwala had vision to back English Vinglish when no one did: R Balki
151.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki remembered late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and called him a great partner. "I was looking for a co-producer for 'English Vinglish'. That's when he came on board...our film was able to roll," he stated. Balki added that Jhunjhunwala had the vision to back 'English Vinglish' when many in the industry didn't have the confidence to do so.

152.title: BEST asked to pay ₹36 lakh to Mumbai man who lost his leg in road mishap
152.article_body: A Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) has ordered the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) to pay over ₹36 lakhs to a 31-year-old man who lost his right leg after a BEST bus hit his motorcycle in Malad in 2017. The man Aslahuddin Shaikh claimed that the bus was rashly driven and had hit his bike from the rear.

153.title: PM Modi lists 5 resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years on Independence Day
153.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech listed five resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years. They are: Developed India, removing every ounce of gulami (slavery) in us, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling our duties. PM Modi said, "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years for the development of the nation."

154.title: India is mother of democracy, our nation's strength is in diversity: PM Modi at Red Fort
154.article_body: Addressing the nation from Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "India is the mother of democracy." "Our nation has proven that we have the inherent strength coming from our diversity and the common thread of patriotism that makes India unshakeable," he added. PM Modi hoisted the National Flag on Independence Day for the ninth straight time.

155.title: At least 300 employees at TikTok previously worked for Chinese state media: Report
155.article_body: As many as 300 current employees at TikTok and its parent company ByteDance previously worked for Chinese state media publications, as per a report. The report added that 15 of these employees currently work for both organisations. Meanwhile, a ByteDance spokesperson said that the company "does not allow employees to hold second or part-time jobs or any outside business activity".

156.title: PM Modi hoists National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day for 9th straight time
156.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today hoisted National Flag for the ninth straight time at the Red Fort on the occasion of Independence Day. Only former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru (17), Indira Gandhi (16) and Manmohan Singh (10) have hoisted the National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day more times than PM Modi. India is celebrating its 76th Independence Day today.

157.title: Inspired by movie 'Special 26', 7 pose as policemen to rob centre in Delhi
157.article_body: Police have arrested seven men for taking inspiration from the Bollywood movie 'Special 26' and robbing a wellness centre in Delhi, police said on Sunday. On the pretext of conducting a raid, they robbed the complainant and his family of ₹5-7 lakh. The accused left with cash, a laptop, 10 phones and bank documents of the victims.

158.title: Water level in Gujarat's Narmada Dam rises, 23 gates opened
158.article_body: The water level in Gujarat's Narmada Dam crossed 135.2 metres, just 2.57 metres short of the Full Reservoir Level of 138.68 metres. Authorities opened 23 of the 30 gates of the dam and released about 1.94 lakh cusecs of water. With this, the level of the Narmada river rose, prompting flood alerts in Narmada, Vadodara and Bharuch districts.

159.title: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's last rites held in Mumbai
159.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday, was cremated at the Banganga Crematorium in Mumbai's Malabar Hill. Jhunjhunwala passed away after a sudden cardiac arrest, as per a doctor. He was suffering from chronic kidney disease and was on chronic dialysis, the doctor stated. He had also undergone an angioplasty recently.

160.title: BJP leader booked for holding Tiranga Yatra in Delhi without permission
160.article_body: BJP leader Kuljeet Singh Chahal was among six people booked for conducting a Tiranga Yatra without permission during the deployment of VIP carcade rehearsal in Delhi, officials said. A case was registered at Tughlak Road police station under sections 186 and 188 of the Indian Penal Code. Across the country, Tiranga Yatras are being undertaken to mark Independence Day.

161.title: 2,162 new COVID-19 cases, 5 deaths reported in Delhi
161.article_body: Delhi logged 2,162 new cases of COVID-19 on Sunday with a positivity rate of 12.64%, according to data shared by the health department. The national capital also recorded five deaths due to the infection. The city's daily caseload remained above the 2,000-mark for the 12th consecutive day. Delhi now has 8,430 active COVID-19 cases.

162.title: 63-year-old Kerala Catholic priest arrested for molesting minor boy
162.article_body: A 63-year-old Catholic priest has been arrested in Kerala for allegedly molesting a minor boy, police said on Sunday. The accused was arrested based on a complaint lodged by the boy's parents, police said. A case was registered under relevant sections of the POCSO Act, police added. The accused is reportedly a priest at a church near Varapuzha.

163.title: Was trying to emulate Yuvraj: Ryan Burl on his 34-run over against Bangladesh
163.article_body: After scoring 34 runs off an over against Bangladesh in a T20I earlier this month, Zimbabwe batter Ryan Burl said that he was trying to "emulate" former Indian batter Yuvraj Singh. "When I tried to hit the [Bangladeshi] left-arm spinner for 36 [runs]...a little bit of flash came when Yuvraj hit Broad for six sixes...he's obviously a legend," Burl said.

164.title: Nitish doesn't stands against Modi; both Kamandal, Mandal are with BJP: Sushil
164.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Modi has said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar "has no standing in front of" PM Narendra Modi. "Nitish has nothing outside Bihar and his influence as the state's leader is also diminishing," Sushil said. He added, "Both Mandal and Kamandal are with BJP...PM Modi represents the aspirations of OBCs in the country."

165.title: Her face has peace of Shimla, but her aggression puts batters in trouble: PM on Renuka
165.article_body: Talking about India Women pacer Renuka Singh, who was the highest wicket-taker at CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi said, "Nobody had the answer against the swing of Renuka Singh Thakur." He added, "Her face has the peace of Shimla and the smile of mountains but her aggression puts the top batters in trouble." Notably, Renuka hails from Shimla.

166.title: IMD predicts light rainfall around Red Fort on Independence Day
166.article_body: The area around Delhi's Red Fort is likely to witness light rainfall and strong winds on Monday, which is also Independence Day, IMD said.  Strong winds occasionally reaching the speed between 20-30 km per hour are likely to prevail between 6 am and 12 noon, IMD added. Notably, the Prime Minister's Independence Day speech is delivered from the Red Fort.

167.title: Yes he made millions but I'll remember him for patriotism: Mahindra on Jhunjhunwala
167.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday paid homage to ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala who passed away today, saying he will remember him for his "unshakeable patriotism". "Yes, he made millions...But my strongest memory will always be...his unwavering belief in India," said Mahindra. "I wish he had made it to the 75th anniversary of our Independence," he added.

168.title: Messi picks Real Madrid's Benzema as favourite to win Ballon d'Or
168.article_body: PSG forward Lionel Messi has picked Real Madrid's Karim Benzema as the favourite to win the 2022 Ballon d'Or. "I don't think there is a single doubt...it's clear Karim Benzema had an unbelievable year," said Messi. Messi, the record seven-time winner of the award, was left out of the 30-player shortlist for this year.

169.title: Chinese and Thai air forces begin joint training exercise
169.article_body: Air forces of China and Thailand commenced a joint training exercise on Sunday at Thailand's Udorn Air Force Base. The exercise has been code-named "Falcon Strike 2022", Xinhua reported. It will include drills such as air support, strikes on ground targets, and troop deployment. Both sides have reportedly sent fighter jets and airborne early warning (AEW) aircraft for the exercise.

170.title: People with disabilities take part in a fashion show in Delhi, pics surface
170.article_body: Fashion Design Council of India (FDCI) and NGO Tamana recently organised an annual fashion show, titled Fashion Beyond Boundaries, which saw people with disabilities taking part in the show. Celebrity designers such as Anju Modi, Rajesh Pratap Singh and others were seen participating. FDCI president Sunil Sethi called the fashion show an "evening of courage and style".

171.title: Asked for extra pay, the brand said it doesn't hire dusky girls: Smrithi
171.article_body: 'Raksha Bandhan' actress Smrithi Srikanth shared that during her modelling days, a brand refused to pay her extra because of her skin tone. She recalled she was shortlisted for two of their projects. However, when she demanded extra pay, she was told that the brand does "not hire dusky girls". "They basically preferred fairer girls," she said.
