172.title: Remains of Indian Army soldier found 38 years after he went missing in Siachen
172.article_body: The mortal remains of a soldier who was part of Operation Meghdoot in Siachen in 1984, were found at a bunker on Saturday. Lance Naik Chandra Shekhar from Uttarakhand's Haldwani had gone missing during the operation 38 years ago. His family, who were informed of the discovery on Sunday, are expected to get his mortal remains on Tuesday.

173.title: Shubman Gill might bat at no. 3 vs Zimbabwe in ODIs: Devang Gandhi
173.article_body: Ex-BCCI national selector Devang Gandhi said India batter Shubman Gill might have to bat at number three in upcoming ODI series against Zimbabwe. Gill opened for India in recent three-match ODI series against West Indies. "While he has done exceedingly well in...Caribbean ODIs, what I can gauge from this team's philosophy is to prepare players for multiple slots," he added.

174.title: Dhoni said 'Bhajju pa, aap vahan se daaloge', I got a wicket: Harbhajan on WC semi vs Pak
174.article_body: Recalling 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh revealed how MS Dhoni's advice led to a wicket. "After a water break, Dhoni told me, 'Bhajju pa, aap vahan se daaloge' (around the wicket). Umar Akmal and Misbah-ul-Haq were playing good," he added. "On the very first ball...I got Umar's wicket...as I bowled around the wicket," Harbhajan added.

175.title: Policeman killed in grenade attack in J&K's Kulgam district
175.article_body: A policeman was killed in a grenade attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Saturday, the police said. The policeman Tahir Khan succumbed to his injuries at an Anantnag hospital. This came hours after a Sub-Inspector was wounded in a separate attack on a CRPF bunker in Srinagar. Khan joined J&K Police in 2019 and hailed from Poonch's Mendhar.

176.title: FPIs invest ₹22,452 crore in Indian equities between Aug 1-12
176.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested ₹22,452 crore in Indian equities between August 1-12 amid softening inflation concerns, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs turned net buyers for first time in July after a 9-month selling streak. They had invested ₹4,989 crore in July 2022. Between October 2021 and June 2022, FPIs sold ₹2.46 lakh crore from Indian equities.

177.title: Saudi Aramco posts $48 bn quarterly profit, reportedly highest-ever for a listed firm
177.article_body: Saudi Aramco on Sunday said that its net income for the second quarter surged to $48.4 billion, driven primarily by higher crude oil prices. This is the biggest quarterly adjusted profit reported by any listed company globally, as per Bloomberg. The oil and gas company, which is nearly entirely state-owned by Saudi Arabia, is among the world's most valuable companies.

178.title: Adivi Sesh visits anti-terror Special Force Octopus campus ahead of I-Day
178.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh, who was seen in the film 'Major', recently visited the Octopus Special Forces campus to celebrate Independence Day. The OCTOPUS was established in 2007 along the lines of the National Security Guards (NSG) to counter terrorist activities. Calling it a "surreal experience", Adivi said, "I salute soldiers' efforts, who are always looking out for our safety."

179.title: Working with Aamir isn't difficult, he's very clear about what he wants: Naga
179.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya in a recent interview opened up about his experience of working with Aamir Khan in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and said that working with the actor is not difficult. "He's very clear about what he wants, or what he set out for that scene, or that episode," he added. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' marked Naga's debut in Bollywood.

180.title: Arijit Singh to start free English coaching centre in Murshidabad: Reports
180.article_body: Singer Arijit Singh is reportedly starting an English coaching centre in Jiaganj, Murshidabad. As per sources, the singer visited a local nursing college to enquire if a room is available for rent to conduct the English classes, which will be free of cost. Shankar Mondal, to whom the college belongs, said Arijit "needed space from 6-8 am".

181.title: J&K launches 75 homestays in partnership with OYO
181.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha launched 75 homestays to commemorate 75 years of India's independence in partnership with OYO. Under the project 'Crown of Incredible India', the homestays will be owned by self-help group members of Jammu and Kashmir Rural Livelihood Mission (JKRLM). Manoj Sinha added that OYO and JKRLM would build 200 more homestays by December 2022.

182.title: Age is just a number, I am proving through my actions: Sharath Kamal
182.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who bagged three gold medals at CWG 2022 at the age of 40, said, "I don’t have to say anything about age being just a number, because I am proving it through my actions!" He added, "These last two weeks were my best two weeks of performance in my career."

183.title: 347 police personnel awarded medals for gallantry; CRPF gets most awards
183.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, 347 Police Medal for Gallantry (PMG) were awarded to police personnel, with Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) receiving 109 medals, the highest of any paramilitary or state police force. J&K Police received 108 PMGs, the highest among states and UTs. A total of 1,082 police personnel were given various awards this year.

184.title: Never seen in football: Arsenal manager on fans' reaction to own goal
184.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said that he has never seen "such support" from fans after defender William Saliba scored an own goal in the team's 4-2 win over Leicester City. "The way they reacted was something I've never seen in football," said Arteta. The Spaniard added that the team couldn't wait to play in front of the crowd again.

185.title: 2 arrested for alleged rape of 17-year-old girl in UP's Pilibhit
185.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl in the Bisalpur area of Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit, police informed on Sunday. According to police, the men have been accused of raping the minor while she was on her way to coaching on Saturday. An FIR was registered by the girl's father under IPC section 376 (Rape) and POCSO Act.

186.title: Taliban didn't form inclusive govt: EU ahead of takeover anniversary
186.article_body: Ahead of the first anniversary of Taliban seizing power in Afghanistan, EU External Action Service (EEAS) said that the Taliban failed to form an inclusive political system in the country. "[Taliban's]...abuses include extrajudicial killings, arbitrary arrests and detentions. Freedom of opinion, expression, press, peaceful assembly and association are being violated," the EEAS said in a statement.

187.title: Ishaan, Mrunal and Priyanshu Painyuli's 'Pippa' to release on Dec 2: Report
187.article_body: Director Raja Menon's 'Pippa', starring Ishaan Khatter, Mrunal Thakur and Priyanshu Painyuli, will reportedly release in theatres on December 2. According to the report, the makers will unveil the teaser on August 15. The upcoming film will feature Ishaan as retired Brigadier Balram Singh Mehta, who fought against Pakistan in 1971's Battle of Garibpur.

188.title: Couldn't skip event despite rain as it'd be linked to Partha: WB CM
188.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, at an event, said she attended the programme despite heavy rainfall as people would otherwise think she skipped it due to MLA Partha Chatterjee's arrest. "Some could say, someone is behind the bar and that is why I skipped this programme," she said. Chatterjee was arrested by ED in the West Bengal school recruitment scam.

189.title: I'm happy Serena Williams is retiring on her terms: Childhood coach Macci
189.article_body: Serena Williams' childhood coach Rick Macci has said he's happy that the 23-time Grand Slam champion is retiring "on her terms". He added, "It doesn't surprise me...she has a lot of things going on." The 40-year-old recently announced that she will be retiring after US Open 2022. Serena won her first Grand Slam title at US Open 1999.

190.title: Lalu Yadav to return to Bihar on Wednesday ahead of floor test
190.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is recovering in Delhi from a hairline fracture, will travel to Patna on Wednesday to meet party leaders and possibly CM Nitish Kumar. The politician is also expected to travel to Hajipur on Friday in connection with a court case. This comes ahead of the JDU-RJD alliance facing a floor test on August 24.

191.title: We could join Bihar Cabinet if given honourable representation: CPI
191.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) said it could be a part of the Bihar Cabinet if given "honourable representation". CPI's Atul Kumar Anjan said they had "nothing to do with the stand" of other Left parties to only offer outside support to the new Grand Alliance Bihar government. Kumar, however, did not elaborate on the party's exact demands.

192.title: Maha govt officials to say Vande Mataram on receiving calls: Minister
192.article_body: All officials of the Maharashtra government will have to say "Vande Mataram" instead of 'Hello" while receiving phone calls in offices, state Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said on Sunday. A formal government order will be out by August 18, he added. Mungantiwar said the decision has been taken as India is celebrating Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav.

193.title: Attack on police post in Pak's South Waziristan leaves 1 dead
193.article_body: A Pakistani police personnel was killed while another was wounded in a militant attack on a police post in South Waziristan tribal district on Saturday, local media reported on Sunday. According to media reports, the attack occurred in Azam Warsak near the Pakistan-Afghanistan border. Heavy weapons were used in the attack, police officials said.

194.title: Govt pursued those who cheated banks, brought back money: Sitharaman
194.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said the Centre has ensured that those who cheated banks and fled were pursued and made to face justice. "We ensure that...their properties are auctioned and the money is given back to the banks and that is happening continuously," Sitharaman added. The government is dealing with legacy problems of previous governments, she further added.

195.title: Tickets for India vs Pak, all other Asia Cup games to go on sale from Monday
195.article_body: Tickets for Asia Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan and all other matches will go on sale from Monday. Asia Cup is scheduled to begin on August 27 in UAE, with Sri Lanka taking on Afghanistan in the tournament opener. India will face Pakistan in a Group A match on August 28. India are the defending champions.

196.title: England's coach doesn't even like their 'Bazball' slogan: Elgar
196.article_body: South Africa's Test skipper Dean Elgar has commented on the newly-coined 'Bazball' term used for the current England Test team. "I think it can go...south very quickly. Their own coach (Brendon McCullum) doesn't even like the slogan they've come up with," Elgar said. He added, "I'd like to see them (English batters) do it (bat aggressively) against our seamers."

197.title: Paytm records loan distribution annual run rate of ₹25,000 cr
197.article_body: Digital financial services company One97 Communications, which operates under the Paytm brand, said that the loan distribution business recorded an annual run rate of around ₹25,000 crore in July. In June, the company reported annual run rate of around ₹24,000 crore for the loan distribution business. Paytm disbursed 29.46 lakh loans in July 2022.

198.title: Startups reduce spending on online marketing by 30-60%
198.article_body: Amid a funding crunch, most startups have reduced their spending on online marketing by 30-60%. Speaking to Moneycontrol, founders and investors in the startup ecosystem said that they have cut down on digital marketing on Google and social media platforms without an impact on the revenues. The limited marketing budgets have instead been refocused on retargeting existing customers.

199.title: Indian Army dog who died to save soldiers' lives last month gets gallantry award
199.article_body: Indian Army's assault dog Axel who had died in the line of duty has been awarded the 'Mention in Despatches' gallantry award on India's 76th Independence Day. The 2-year-old Belgian Malinois was shot thrice during a counter-terror operation in J&K last month. He died while carrying out a risky room intervention thereby saving soldiers' lives.

200.title: 'Pushpa' music composer DSP to hoist Tricolour at Times Square in New York
200.article_body: Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for 'Pushpa: The Rise', will hoist the Tricolour at Times Square in New York on Independence Day. "I'm...honoured to be invited as...guest of honour for the ceremonial lighting of Empire State Building & Indian flag hoisting at Times Square," he tweeted. The event has been organised by the Federation of Indian Associations.

201.title: Nykaa appoints Vishal Gupta executive VP for consumer beauty brands
201.article_body: FSN E-commerce ventures, the parent company of Nykaa, has appointed IIT Delhi and IIM Bangalore alumnus Vishal Gupta as the executive Vice President for its consumer beauty brands.Gupta joined Nykaa after working with Unilever for 25 years. He has nearly three decades of experience in the FMCG sector across India, Indonesia, Southeast Asia, and Russia.

202.title: We will have fully realised our freedom fighters' dreams by 2047: Prez
202.article_body: By 2047, India will have fully realised the dreams of her freedom fighters, President Droupadi Murmu said in her maiden address on the eve of India's 76th Independence Day. "We're already on course to build an Aatmanirbhar Bharat, an India that would have realised its true potential," she said. "After independence, all the generations have toiled hard," she added.

203.title: Fun, curious & a millennial mess: Siddhant Chaturvedi on ‘Kho Gaye…’
203.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi wrapped Zoya Akhtar's 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'. The actor described it as a "fun, curious and a millennial mess". He thanked the team for "the best filming experience" and called his co-stars Kalki Koechlin, Ananya Panday and Adarsh Gourav his "friends for life". "I have only grown working alongside you both," he wrote.

204.title: Kashmir's first-ever multiplex cinema to open in early September
204.article_body: The first multiplex theatre in Kashmir is set to open in the Valley's Sonawar area in early September. According to the owner, the complex will have three movie halls with a total capacity of 520 seats and multiple food courts. The building has come up at the site where the Broadway single-screen theatre used to be located.

205.title: Ayodhya priest tries to burn Pak flag in UP; police intervene
205.article_body: A priest from Ayodhya was stopped by the police as the former was allegedly trying to burn the national flag of Pakistan in UP's Barabanki on Sunday. The priest, Mahant Paramhans Acharya, allegedly tried to set the flag ablaze while addressing his followers at a function before police intervened. Later, he was sent back to Ayodhya, police said.

206.title: Water enters Cuttack's Bhattarika temple due to floods in Odisha
206.article_body: Incessant rain has led to flooding in many parts of Odisha including Cuttack where water entered the Bhattarika temple. Over 1,000 people were evacuated as gates of the Hirakud Dam were opened, leading to flooding in Sambalpur. Several areas around the Mahanadi river have also been inundated, with 21 areas reporting 116.8 mm to 204.4 mm of rainfall.

207.title: Indian taekwondo players Afreen, Shivansh win bronze medals at Israel Open G2
207.article_body: Indian taekwondo players Afreen Hyder and Shivansh Tyagi won bronze medals at the ongoing Israel Open G2 tournament. Afreen bagged the bronze in women's 62 kg weight category, while Tyagi won it in men's 74 kg weight category. Both Afreen and Tyagi are the top ranked Indian athletes in their respective weight categories.

208.title: YouTube plans to launch online store for streaming video services: Report
208.article_body: Alphabet's YouTube is planning to launch an online store for streaming video services, the Wall Street Journal reported. YouTube has renewed talks with entertainment firms about participating in the platform, which is reportedly being referred to internally as a "channel store". The platform could reportedly be available as early as this fall.

209.title: Vicky's name in Uri was inspired by Hrithik's name in Lakshya: Aditya Dhar
209.article_body: 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar has revealed that actor Vicky Kaushal's name in the film, Vihan Singh Shergill, was inspired by Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya', which was Karan Shergill. "I really love Lakshya, so in my own way I paid a small tribute to that film by giving Vicky's character the same surname," Aditya further said.

210.title: Beating retreat ceremony held at Attari-Wagah border on I-Day eve
210.article_body: The beating retreat ceremony took place at the Attari-Wagah Border in Punjab's Amritsar on the eve of India's 76th Independence Day on Sunday. A huge crowd had gathered at the Attari-Wagah border for the ceremony. People sang songs of patriotism, danced and hoisted the Indian national flag.

211.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie is result of Iranian incitement: Israel
211.article_body: Condemning the recent stabbing of 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie, Israel has termed the attack the result of "decades of incitement" by Iranian regime. "Attack on Salman Rushdie is an attack on our freedoms and values," Israeli PM Yair Lapid has tweeted. Rushdie, who was stabbed during a literary event in New York, was taken off ventilator on Saturday.

212.title: 80% firms globally have suffered a cyberattack in last 1 year: Study
212.article_body: A study by technology firm Acronis has showed that 80% of firms it surveyed suffered a cybersecurity breach in last one year, up from 68% from the previous year. Meanwhile, 9% of the firms also experienced at least one cyberattack/hour. The study further states that three in 10 surveyed companies reported facing a cyberattack at least once a day.

213.title: Kuwait appoints its first ambassador to Iran since 2016
213.article_body: Kuwait has appointed its first ambassador to Iran since 2016, both countries confirmed on Sunday. Ambassador Bader Abdullah Al-Munaikh presented his credentials to Iran's Foreign Minister on Saturday, Iranian foreign ministry's website said. Kuwait had recalled its ambassador to Iran in 2016 when Saudi Arabia broke diplomatic ties with Iran.

214.title: Yogi Adityanath overwhelmed to see Independence Day participation
214.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it was "overwhelming to see every section" participate with enthusiasm in celebrating Independence Day week. He added that all "must work together to build an India we dream of" with the 'Nation First, Always First' mantra. Adityanath said UP had the responsibility to celebrate in a grand manner as it was the most populous state.

215.title: Cong MP shares pics of Pt Nehru's handwritten 'Tryst with Destiny' I-Day speech
215.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh shared pictures of a handwritten draft of first PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's famous 'Tryst with Destiny' speech, delivered on the eve of India's Independence on August 15, 1947. "He had penned it as 'date with destiny', but in a moment of true genius, delivered it as 'tryst with destiny'," said Ramesh. The draft is dated 14/08/1947.

216.title: Always a big advantage when there's no Bumrah: Kaia ahead of ODIs vs India
216.article_body: Ahead of India-Zimbabwe three-match ODI series, Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia said there's always a big advantage when pacer Jasprit Bumrah is not playing for Team India. "He's the number one bowler in the world. So, of course, for us to not face him is an advantage," he added. Bumrah has been rested for the series due to a back injury.

217.title: Salman Khan asked me to not be a part of 'Bhaijaan': Aayush Sharma
217.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma said it was Salman Khan's decision to not let him be a part of 'Bhaijaan'. Aayush shared that Salman thought working on the film right after 'Antim' "would dilute the importance" of them coming back together on screen. "He said 'why don't we wait for some time, get something else and then we come together,'" Aayush concluded.

218.title: Ranveer wins Best Actor award for ’83’ at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
218.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has won the Best Actor award for '83' at the latest edition of the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IIFM). In the Kabir Khan directorial, Ranveer played the role of former Indian cricket captain Kapil Dev. Reacting to the win, Ranveer said the film will "always be one of the most cherished films" in his filmography.

219.title: Govt, policy-makers deserve credit for helping economy flourish: Prez
219.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu, while addressing the country on the eve of Independence Day, said the government and policy-makers deserve credit for beating global trends and helping the economy flourish. She said a new India has risen in recent years, more so after the COVID-19 outbreak. It was her first address to the nation on the eve of Independence Day.

220.title: Woman's body found buried in field in Gorakhpur; husband booked
220.article_body: The body of a 28-year-old woman was found buried in a field after a local noticed a foul smell in Pipra Miglan village in Gorakhpur, UP. The deceased, Radhika Nishad, had a rift with her husband, Amit Nishad, and had been living with her mother Gita Devi, police said. The husband was booked after a complaint was filed by Devi.

221.title: Remarkable: PM Modi on video of 'Human Tiranga' formation at height of 15,000 feet
221.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to react to a video shared by DRDO showing the first-ever skydiving formation of 'Human Tiranga' at a height of 15,000 feet above the ground level. "Remarkable," PM Modi wrote. The formation was created by Aerial Delivery Research and Development Establishment, Agra as part of celebrations of India's 75 years of independence.

222.title: Women are breaking many glass ceilings: Prez Murmu on I-Day eve
222.article_body: Ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu in her maiden speech said that gender inequalities have reduced in India, adding that "women are breaking many glass ceilings". "Our daughters are the biggest hope for [our] nation," President Murmu further said. Notably, President Murmu, who took charge on July 25, is the first tribal woman to become India's President.

223.title: OTT has given a new lease of life to many including me: Chak De! actress Vidya
223.article_body: 'Chak De! India' actress Vidya Malavade, who was recently seen in show 'Dr. Arora', has said OTT has changed things for everyone. "It has given a new lease of life to many including me," she added. Vidya further said the last three-four years have turned the tables for her, adding, "I'm enjoying every bit of my work at the moment."

224.title: I miss you every day papa: Riteish on Vilasrao's death anniversary
224.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh on Sunday remembered his father and former Maharashtra CM Vilasrao Deshmukh on his death anniversary. "It's been 10 years...I miss you every day Pappa," he wrote. Actress Genelia Deshmukh, wife of Riteish, also penned a note remembering Vilasrao and wrote, "I know you've been with us through our toughest times and laughed with us through...lighter times."

225.title: I was an IPL newbie, they had more trust in me: GT's Kishore on Hardik, Nehra
225.article_body: Sharing his experience of playing under Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya and head coach Ashish Nehra in IPL 2022, spinner Sai Kishore said both of them are "genuine". He added, "The wickets in Mumbai were great and playing another spinner didn't make sense. I was an IPL newbie and they had more trust in me after I played two games."

226.title: BJP panchayat member arrested in Uttarakhand paper leak case
226.article_body: BJP panchayat member Hakam Singh Rawat was arrested on Sunday in connection with the Uttarakhand Subordinate Service Selection Commission (UKSSSC) paper leak. Police said Rawat is one of the masterminds of the leak. UKSSSC conducted a written exam on December 4 and 5 in 2021 and this was the biggest examination of the commission for 854 posts.

227.title: Minor, on way to meet her brother on Raksha Bandhan, gang-raped in Bihar
227.article_body: A minor, who was on her way to her brother's house to celebrate Raksha Bandhan, was gang-raped in Bihar's Siwan. She was kidnapped by four persons, taken to a bush along the roadside and raped. The accused fled after a passerby came close to the crime scene upon hearing the girl's screams. The passerby admitted the girl to the hospital.

228.title: Keyword for India today is compassion for needy: President on I-Day eve
228.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu, in her maiden address to the nation on the eve of Independence Day on Sunday, said, "Keyword for India today is compassion for downtrodden, for needy and for those on margins." She added that in the past few years, a new India has taken shape. "Gender inequalities are reducing...women are breaking many glass ceilings," the President said.

229.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes his highest-ever one-day score, slams 20 fours and 5 sixes
229.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara on Sunday smashed his highest-ever score in one-day cricket. The 34-year-old scored 174(131) against Surrey while representing Sussex in a Royal London One-Day Cup 2022 match. He slammed 20 fours and five sixes. Pujara's previous highest List A score had come on September 30, 2012, when he hit 158*(126) for India B against India A.

230.title: Savarkar proposed 2 nation theory, Jinnah supported it: Cong to BJP
230.article_body: Hours after the BJP shared a video blaming Jawaharlal Nehru for partition, Congress on Sunday responded by claiming that Veer Savarkar was the one who proposed the "two-nation theory", which was supported by Jinnah. "These people are divisive. What was their role in the independence of the country?" asked Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel.

231.title: 1 dead, 36 injured as explosion hits market in Armenia's capital
231.article_body: One person was killed and 36 others were injured after an explosion ripped through the Surmalu market in Armenia's capital Yerevan on Sunday, setting off a large fire, Armenia's emergency response ministry confirmed. The explosion reportedly occurred at a fireworks storage area. It was not immediately known what caused the fireworks to ignite.

232.title: SRK, Gauri Khan join Har Ghar Tiranga campaign, pose with Tricolour at Mannat
232.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan joined the Har Ghar Tiranga campaign. Gauri shared a picture of herself, Shah Rukh and their sons Aryan and AbRam posing with the Tricolour at their house 'Mannat'. Several other celebrities including Salman Khan, Alia Bhatt, Kartik Aaryan, Mohanlal, Vivek Agnihotri and Neil Nitin Mukesh, also joined the campaign.

233.title: Amber hired me to find bad things about Depp, fired me when I came empty handed: Detective
233.article_body: Investigator Paul Barresi has revealed actress Amber Heard hired him to find bad things about her ex-husband Johnny Depp. "Amber hired me in the summer of July 2019. I searched on every rock, every stone, all over the world to find out bad things about Johnny," he added. He further said that she fired him after he came empty handed.

234.title: ITBP to scale 75 peaks, go on 75-day patrol to mark 75 yrs of independence
234.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel will scale 75 peaks on Independence Day and complete a 75-day-long patrol along the LAC with China to mark 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, a senior officer said. The mountain expedition will cover 33 peaks in Ladakh and 16 in Uttarakhand, among others. The patrol, which started on August 1, will conclude on October 14.

235.title: Probing threat made to JK Rowling over Rushdie tweet: Scotland Police
235.article_body: Scottish police have said they're investigating a report of an online threat made to author JK Rowling over her tweet condemning the stabbing of author Salman Rushdie. Enquiries are being carried out, a spokeswoman for Scottish police said. "Feeling very sick...let [Rushdie] be ok," Rowling had tweeted, in response to which a user wrote, "Don't worry you are next".

236.title: Delhi CM Kejriwal, Deputy Sisodia attend 'Har Hath Tiranga' event
236.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia attended the 'Har Hath Tiranga' programme on Independence Day eve. Kejriwal said that India has completed 75 years of Independence but it is still running behind several countries, including those that got freedom after India. Kejriwal added that we can take India to the top if we all work together.

237.title: Media reports on 'war game' with Pak Navy are false: Sri Lankan Navy
237.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy has refuted certain media reports terming its passage exercise with Pakistan Navy a 'war game', terming the reports to be ''fallacious". The reports come amid Pakistan Navy Ship (PNS) Taimur's proposed passage exercise with Sri Lanka Navy Ship (SLNS) Sindurala off the coast of Colombo before PNS Taimur departs from Sri Lanka on August 15.

238.title: A motivating interaction: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sharath on meeting PM Modi
238.article_body: After meeting PM Narendra Modi at his residence, Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who won three gold and one silver medals at Commonwealth Games 2022, said it was a motivating interaction with the PM. "Support extended to the fullest and encouraging words from...leaders of our nation ignites greater fire within to win more medals for the country," he added.

239.title: Cong to get 3 ministerial berths in new Bihar govt: AICC's state in-charge
239.article_body: AICC's Bihar in-charge Bhakta Charan Das has informed that Congress will get three ministerial berths in the newly-formed Bihar government. "Two Congress legislators will take oath on 16 August...One more party legislator will be inducted in the Nitish Kumar cabinet when the next expansion takes place," Das said. Notably, the Grand Alliance comprises seven parties and over 160 legislators.

240.title: Don’t think I’d repeat that: Tamannaah on glamorous roles
240.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia said she has starred in films where female leads were seen as the love interests or the eye candies. The actress said that while she doesn't look down upon such films, she doesn't "want to repeat" them. Tamannaah also thanked the OTT platforms for allowing her to explore roles that she "could not do 10-12 years go".

241.title: Varun Dhawan is a complete package: Naga Chaitanya
241.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha,' said Varun Dhawan will be a perfect fit to star in his film 'Tadakha' if it is ever remade in Hindi. The actor said Varun can act and dance well, which makes him "a complete package". 'Tadakha', a Kishore Kumar Pardasani directorial, was released in 2013.

242.title: Conceded goals from individual mistakes: Man Utd manager on loss to Brentford
242.article_body: After losing their Premier League match to Brentford by 4-0 on Saturday, Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said that they "conceded goals from individual mistakes". "Brentford were more hungry," Hag said. The 52-year-old Dutchman added, "After 35 minutes we conceded four goals. This is not possible...You can't have a tactical plan but then put it in the bin."

243.title: Ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala had produced 3 Bollywood movies
243.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away today, had produced three Bollywood films. He produced the 2012 film 'English Vinglish', which marked the late Sridevi's return to movies after a long hiatus. He also produced the 2015 release 'Shamitabh' with Amitabh Bachchan and Dhanush in lead roles and 'Ki&Ka', which was released in 2016 and starred Kareena Kapoor Khan and Arjun Kapoor.

244.title: Come together without any biases: Rajinikanth on 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
244.article_body: As a part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, actor Rajinikanth has requested his fans to hoist the national flag outside their homes as a mark of respect to the freedom fighters. "I request you all to come together without any caste, religious, and political biases and fly our national flag on a small pole outside our homes," he said.

245.title: A visionary, a true patriot: Anil Kapoor on Rakesh Jhunjhunwala
245.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Sunday remembered his "dear friend" and late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Calling Jhunjhunwala a "true patriot" and a "visionary", Anil tweeted that he "loved films and music" and was "a well-wisher" of the actor's family, especially of his daughters Rhea Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor. "Will miss him dearly," Anil concluded. Jhunjhunwala passed away on August 14.

246.title: AC Milan and Inter Milan turn down chance to sign Ronaldo: Report
246.article_body: Italian clubs AC Milan and Inter Milan have rejected the chance to sign Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo, a report said. This comes after earlier claims that teams like Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich, and PSG did not wish to sign the five-time Ballon d'Or winner. Ronaldo played in both of United's 1-2 and 0-4 losses against Brighton and Brentford, respectively.

247.title: Hope Shane Warne's proud: Alana King after her hat-trick in The Hundred
247.article_body: Australian leg-spinner Alana King said she hoped the late Shane Warne was proud of her after she took the first-ever hat-trick in the women's edition of The Hundred. "I hope (Warne)...is pretty proud I spun it a bit," said King. The hat-trick came at the same Old Trafford ground where Warne bowled the ball of the century in 1993.

248.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic withdraws from Western and Southern Open in Cincinnati
248.article_body: World number six Novak Djokovic has withdrawn from next week's Western and Southern Open in Cincinnati due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. The 35-year-old has not gotten any COVID-19 vaccine shots and is not allowed to travel to the US. Djokovic has said he won't get vaccinated against coronavirus, even if that prevents him from playing in certain tournaments.

249.title: Beti Bachao was a pretence: Cong to BJP over 'unfulfilled' promises
249.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday criticised the BJP over its "unfulfilled" promises to the family of the Hathras victim, who died after being gang-raped by four men. Rahul said that the 'Beti Bachao' slogan was just a "pretence" and that BJP has never hesitated in doing "injustice" to women.

250.title: Don't give it too much attention: Chhetri to teammates on FIFA ban threat
250.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri has advised his teammates to "not give too much attention" to FIFA's suspension threat to the All India Football Federation (AIFF). "My advice is to not give it too much attention because it's out of your control," said Chhetri. FIFA's warning came after claims of third-party "influence" in the Indian body.

251.title: What is this 'Swachh Bharat' if it cannot restore dignity to Indians?: Yechury
251.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has criticised the Centre for allegedly being unable to stop the practice of manual scavenging. "This obnoxious indignity must end...[In] 1993, manual scavenging [got] banned...[and in] 2013 PEMSRA [was] enacted...Yet three [people] die at work every five days," Yechury tweeted. "What is this 'Swachh Bharat' if it cannot restore dignity to Indians?" he asked.

252.title: No work, no pay: HC on teacher’s plea for salary during his imprisonment
252.article_body: Bombay High Court has rejected the plea of a retired teacher who sought a salary for the period he was jailed for allegedly murdering his wife. The court said the principle of "no work, no pay" would apply to the case. The teacher was arrested for the alleged killing of his wife and convicted in 2008 for the offence.

253.title: Probe video of inspector assaulting man: Women's body to Pune Police
253.article_body: Maharashtra State Commission for Women said that it has directed the Pune Police Commissioner to probe a purported video showcasing a senior police inspector assaulting and hurling abuses at a man. The inspector, Rajesh Puranik, led several raids to bust online gambling rackets recently. The purported video was filmed during questioning of the accused in one such raid, officials said.

254.title: 8-foot-long crocodile enters residential colony in MP, video surfaces
254.article_body: A video surfaced online showing an eight-foot-long crocodile inside a residential colony in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri. The crocodile entered the colony amid heavy rainfall. According to SDPO Ajay Bhargava, a rescue team from Madhav National Park caught the crocodile after an hour-long effort. According to officials, the crocodile must've entered the colony from an overflowing drain.

255.title: Kartik dances & plays tug of war with Indian Navy officers, shares videos
255.article_body: Kartik Aaryan spent a day with some officers of the Indian Navy ahead of Independence Day and shared pictures and videos from his visit on his Instagram handle. In the videos, the actor can be seen playing tug of war, dancing and making rotis on a roti-making machine. Kartik was also seen posing with a gun in his hand.

256.title: B'luru woman calls police after sensing life threat; found dead later
256.article_body: An 83-year-old woman was found dead at her residence on Saturday in Bengaluru's HSR Layout 1 area. The 83-year-old woman had called the police multiple times and alleged that she faced the threat of being murdered. The woman's diamonds have also been stolen by the attackers, police investigation revealed. The security guard is on the run, reports said.

257.title: Tata pens note for Jhunjhunwala, says 'he'll be remembered for his kindness'
257.article_body: Businessman Ratan Tata penned a note to condole the death of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "[He] will always be remembered for his acute understanding of the stock exchanges of India," said Tata, adding, "He will always be remembered for his jovial personality, his kindness and his foresightedness." Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

258.title: 4 held with MD worth ₹29 lakh in Guj; supplier based in Mumbai
258.article_body: Four persons were arrested allegedly with mephedrone (MD) worth ₹29 lakh, while they were bringing the banned drug from Mumbai to Ahmedabad in Gujarat, a police official said on Sunday. The two accused travelled to Surat on a bus belonging to a travel agency and then reached Ahmedabad along with the other two accused, a police release informed.

259.title: Minor-led group held for burglary in Hyd, items worth lakhs seized
259.article_body: A minor and his two adult accomplices were arrested by police in Hyderabad on Saturday for allegedly committing burglary at the house of the minor's employer. The minor allegedly planned the burglary that took place on August 8. Police reportedly recovered cash and valuables, including jewellery and a car, of a combined worth of ₹23 lakh from the group's possession.

260.title: K'taka CM is RSS' slave: Siddaramaiah on exclusion of Nehru from govt ad
260.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah called Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai an "RSS slave" over the exclusion of Jawaharlal Nehru from the list of freedom fighters in the government advertisement published in newspapers on Sunday. "Not including Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru in the list of freedom fighters in today's government ad shows how low a CM can go to save his chair," he said.

261.title: Janhvi remembers mom Sridevi on her birth anniversary, shares throwback pic
261.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering her late mother, veteran actress Sridevi, on her birth anniversary. Sharing a childhood picture of herself with her mother, Janhvi wrote, "Happy birthday Mumma. I miss you more and more every day." Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai to attend a family wedding.

262.title: 2 B'deshi nationals held in Delhi with 11 passports, fake govt stamps
262.article_body: The Delhi Police have apprehended two Bangladeshi nationals from the city's Palam area and recovered from them several passports as well as 10 fake stamps belonging to various Bangladesh ministries, according to an official. "On search, [the accused] were found to be in possession of 11 passports of different Bangladeshi citizens...About the...stamps, they had no substantive answer," police said.

263.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms added ₹1.56 lakh cr to m-cap last week
263.article_body: The combined market capitalisation (m-cap) of six of the top 10 most valued firms surged by ₹1.56 lakh crore last week. While Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance recorded gains in their m-cap, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation suffered losses. Reliance Industries' m-cap rose the most to ₹17.81 lakh crore.

264.title: Railways to hold heritage run of 167-year-old steam engine on I-Day
264.article_body: Indian Railways will hold a heritage run of a 167-year-old locomotive, which is the world's oldest working steam engine, on Independence Day. The special service will run between Chennai's Egmore and Kodambakkam railway stations. "The beautiful sound of the whistle will send you back to the times of the steam locomotive from the days gone by," Divisional Railway Manager said.

265.title: B'luru Traffic Police shares list of roads to be avoided on I-Day
265.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has shared a list of roads to be avoided on August 15 due to various Independence Day events. It has been advised to avoid taking Cubbon Road from 7 am to 11 am. As per the advisory, MKK Road, Tumkur Road, Vatal Nagraj Road, and Rajkumar Road will remain affected between 8 am and 12 pm.

266.title: BlueBenx dismisses staff, suspends withdrawals after $32 mn hack: Report
266.article_body: Brazilian crypto lender BlueBenx laid off a majority of its staff and barred withdrawals of all its 22,000 members after an alleged theft of $32 million in cryptocurrency, Cointelegraph reported. An anonymous investor reportedly said there's a high probability of it being a scam as the theft "seems like...something they invented". BlueBenx had guaranteed up to 66% returns on cryptocurrency.

267.title: Such a dexterous actor: Russo Brothers on Dhanush's performance in 'Jagame...'
267.article_body: Russo Brothers have praised Dhanush's performance in his 2021 action movie 'Jagame Thandhiram'. "He is such a dexterous actor. He is able to do this very intense action, while at the same time holding on to an attitude and almost a casualness in this character," Anthony Russo said. The filmmaker duo worked with Dhanush in the film 'The Gray Man'.

268.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran plays Jaishankar's clip in rally, says 'This is an independent country'
268.article_body: During a rally in Lahore, ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan played a clip of an interview of India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and said, "This is what an independent country is." In the clip, Jaishankar responded to criticism of India buying Russian oil, saying, "Our total purchases for the month would be less than what Europe does in an afternoon."

269.title: At least 40 people killed after massive fire inside a church in Egypt
269.article_body: At least 40 people have been killed and several others have been injured after a massive fire broke out inside a church in Egypt. The fire erupted when around 5,000 worshippers had gathered for the mass at the Coptic Abu Sifin church in the Imbaba neighbourhood. The fire blocked an entrance to the church, causing a stampede.

270.title: 791 new cases of COVID-19 logged in Bengaluru on Saturday
270.article_body: Bengaluru reported 791 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Saturday with a positivity rate of 6.48%, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike chief Tushar Giri Nath. The cases took Bengaluru's active case count to 6,781. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded on Saturday. With the addition of the new cases, Bengaluru's COVID-19 tally reached 18,50,840.

271.title: Militant attack thwarted in Manipur ahead of 76th I-Day; 7 arrested
271.article_body: At least seven militants of the banned People's Liberation Army have been arrested from across Manipur ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, police said on Sunday. The Assam Rifles had received inputs about the outfit's plot to target government installations and security forces with explosives on August 15, police said. Ammunition including hand grenades has been seized, police added.

272.title: 'Totally unacceptable': Kerala Guv on Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark
272.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday criticised remarks made by LDF leader KT Jaleel on Kashmir and said it was "totally unacceptable". Jaleel kicked off a row after he shared a Facebook post, where he called Jammu and Kashmir "Indian adheena Jammu and Kashmir" (India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir) and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir "Azad Kashmir".

273.title: Portfolios allocated in Maha; CM keeps Urban Development, Fadnavis gets Home & Finance
273.article_body: Portfolios were allocated to Maharashtra ministers on Sunday as Chief Minister Eknath Shinde kept Urban Development, Information and Technology, and Information and Public Relations, among other portfolios. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis got Home, and Finance and Planning, among other ministries. Shambhuraj Desai got State Excise, Uday Samant got Industries and Mangal Prabhat Lodha got Tourism.

274.title: He's in same bracket as Woods, Muhammad Ali: Raza on Kohli's comparison vs Babar
274.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza praised Virat Kohli as he compared the India batter with Pakistan captain Babar Azam, saying he would like to put Kohli in the same bracket as Tiger Woods and Muhammad Ali. "These people kind of revolutionised their sports, they thought outside the box and they tried something new which was later followed by everybody," he added.

275.title: Rahul Gandhi is silent: BJP leader after Dalit boy's death in Rajasthan
275.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten by his teacher leading to his death for drinking water from the latter’s pot in Rajasthan, BJP’s Y Satya Kumar said Congress' Rahul Gandhi "who has commented on every subject of the country is silent" on this matter. "This incident...is embarrassing. Incidents of atrocities on Dalits are...increasing in the state," Kumar tweeted.

276.title: 2-time champion Halep beats US' Pegula to reach 4th National Bank Open final
276.article_body: Two-time champion Simona Halep entered the final of National Bank Open, beating US' Jessie Pegula  2-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the semi-final in Toronto on Saturday. This is Halep's fourth final at the tournament. Halep will face Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia, who beat 14th-seeded Karolina Pliskova of the Czech Republic 6-4, 7-6(9-7) in the other semifinal.

277.title: WhatsApp working to let users set avatars as display pics: Report
277.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature which would let users set an avatar as a display picture, WABetaInfo said. It has obtained a screenshot which showed how the feature would allow users to customise avatars and choose a background colour. WhatsApp was reportedly working on a feature to allow users to answer video calls using an animated avatar.

278.title: Man suffers burn injuries as electric bike explodes in Hyderabad
278.article_body: A man sustained burn injuries on his hands and other parts of the body after his electric bike exploded in Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram on Saturday evening, news reports said. The incident reportedly occurred in NGO colony when 33-year-old Koteshwar Rao turned on the switch to charge his two-wheeler. Rao was rushed to a nearby hospital where he is undergoing treatment.

279.title: 20-yr-old woman jumps from building after friend rapes her in Mumbai
279.article_body: The Vashi Police arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman after offering her food laced with drugs. The woman jumped from the fourth floor of her residence following the incident and sustained multiple injuries and fractures. API Kamlakar Sontake of Vashi police station said that the accused and the victim know each other.

280.title: Man who gave death threats to UP CM Yogi arrested from Rajasthan
280.article_body: A man who allegedly gave death threats to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath a few days back was arrested from Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Sunday. A WhatsApp message threatening to kill the CM was sent on UP Police's Dial-112 helpline. He threatened to bomb CM Adityanath within three days.

281.title: Victoria Beckham's fashion label under £54 million debt: Report
281.article_body: Victoria Beckham's namesake fashion brand has reportedly accumulated a debt of £53.9 million. The fashion brand along with Beckham's new make-up company lost £6.6 million in 2020 and was up to £15.6 million in debts in 2019. Notably, David and Victoria Beckham's joint empire reportedly doubled its profit to £11.6 million in 2020.

282.title: Don't let hate campaign destroy something beautiful: Aamir's niece on 'Laal...'
282.article_body: Actress Zayn Marie Khan, niece of Aamir Khan, has come out in support of the actor over boycott calls against his latest release 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. She shared a video on her Instagram Stories, requesting everyone to watch the movie. "If you've ever felt entertained by Aamir Khan...watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha', don't let...hate campaign destroy something truly beautiful," Zayn said.

283.title: #BoycottVikramVedha trends on Twitter after Hrithik praises Aamir's 'Laal...'
283.article_body: After Hrithik Roshan praised Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', '#boycottVikramVedha' started trending on Twitter in India. Hrithik watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in a theatre in Mumbai on Saturday and later urged people to watch the film. "This movie is just magnificent. Don't miss this gem guys," Hrithik wrote on Twitter. Hrithik's 'Vikram Vedha' is slated to release on September 30.

284.title: Delhi Police seals shops near Red Fort ahead of Independence Day
284.article_body: Delhi Police on Sunday sealed shops near the Red Fort for security reasons ahead of Independence Day. Around 400 CCTV cameras will be covered in and around the Red Fort area to monitor the security, a police officer said. According to police, over 10,000 police personnel will be deployed around the monument as around 7,000 invitees will arrive there.

285.title: Climate activists fill golf holes with cement in protest in France
285.article_body: Climate activists filled cement in golf course holes near France's Toulouse in a protest over the water ban exemption given to golf courses as the country faces severe drought. In a petition to get the exemption removed, the activists said that this showed that "economic madness takes precedence over ecological reason". Some restrictions on golf courses remain, reported BBC.

286.title: President's Rule should be imposed in Rajasthan: Mayawati
286.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death in an alleged casteist attack in Rajasthan's Jalore district, former UP CM Mayawati demanded the imposition of President's Rule in the state. "This incident is a clear example...that the Congress government has failed in protecting the life...of people, especially the Dalits, tribals and the neglected," Mayawati said.

287.title: US man asks about buying rifles at shop then attacks 3 with machete
287.article_body: A man was arrested after he attacked three people with a machete at a shop in Patchogue in US' New York, police said on Saturday. The incident occurred after the accused allegedly asked an employee at the shop about buying rifles but on being asked to provide identification, he showed the identification before pulling it back and walking away.

288.title: Jhunjhunwala was on chronic dialysis, had recently undergone angioplasty: Doctor
288.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was on chronic dialysis due to a chronic kidney disease and had recently undergone an angioplasty, Doctor Pratit Samdani of Breach Candy Hospital said. Jhunjhunwala, who was also diabetic, was responding well, the doctor added. He passed away due to a sudden cardiac arrest and was brought dead to the Mumbai hospital on Sunday morning.

289.title: PM misusing partition trauma as fodder for political battles: Congress
289.article_body: Congress has alleged that PM Narendra Modi's real intent behind marking August 14 as 'Partition Horrors Remembrance Day' is to misuse "most traumatic historical events as fodder for his current political battles". "The tragedy of partition cannot be misused to fuel hate and prejudice," Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted. BJP earlier said it'll organise silent marches across India on Sunday.

290.title: Should’ve sided with BJP when people voted for Sena-BJP alliance: Maha CM
290.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he should have sided with the BJP two and a half years ago when people voted for their alliance. "People voted for Shiv Sena-BJP alliance and now if I am with BJP. Where did I go wrong?" Shinde asked. Furthermore, he said, "I am still a local leader who works for the people’s benefit."

291.title: 108-foot tall national flag installed in North Kashmir
291.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, a 108-foot tall national flag has been installed at Hyderbeigh in J&K's Baramulla. The move aims to encourage people to hoist the tricolour. "This is the first of its kind installed in North Kashmir. I thank the citizens of this region to take forward the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign,” Major General SS Slaria said.

292.title: UN-chartered ship to carry 23,000 tons of wheat to Africa: UN
292.article_body: The UN-chartered ship MV Brave Commander will depart Ukraine for Africa after it finishes loading more than 23,000 tons of wheat, a UN official said. The first Africa-bound humanitarian food aid cargo will head to Ethiopia via a grain corridor under the Black Sea Grain Initiative. UN World Food Programme and US Agency for International Development have funded the cargo.

293.title: Moosewala's close friends involved in murder, will reveal their names soon: Father
293.article_body: Balkaur Singh, the father of slain Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, has alleged that close friends of Moosewala were involved in his murder, adding that he would soon reveal their names. According to reports, Balkaur Singh has also been receiving death threats on WhatsApp from numbers based in Pakistan. Singh's security was beefed up after he received threats, reports added.

294.title: Everyone has right to voice opinions: Pankaj Tripathi on boycott trend
294.article_body: Reacting to the ongoing boycott trend against 'Raksha Bandhan' and 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Pankaj Tripathi said that people have the right to share their opinions. The actor added that while films are "a big medium that generate revenue to the government" and contribute to the betterment of the society, it is people's wish to watch them or not.

295.title: IIT Kanpur team develops app to help kids with learning disabilities
295.article_body: A team at IIT Kanpur has developed an application called Assistive Application for Children with Dyslexia and Dysgraphia (AACDD). The application provides a training module for school-going children between classes 1 and 5 in the Hindi language. The touchscreen-based interface uses haptic sensation and motor movement to produce Hindi letters and involves auditory feedback.

296.title: India have better pacers than Shami in T20 cricket: Ponting
296.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said India have better pacers than Mohammad Shami in T20 cricket. "[Shami] has been a very good bowler for India for a long time now. If you look at his strengths, his Test cricket is probably where he thrives the most," added Ponting. Shami hasn't been named in India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup.

297.title: All languages in country are national languages: RSS chief
297.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said, "All languages in the country are national languages, all people from various castes are mine, we need to have such affection." People have small differences in language, dress and culture but they need to have a mind that will see the big picture and not get stuck into these things, he added.

298.title: Tiranga rally with 100-meter-long flag organised in Dehradun
298.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, Dehradun police organised a Tiranga rally yatra with a 100-meter-long national flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "We organised this rally to make the people aware about the campaign which was launched by the Centre. This rally aims to ask people to work to intact the country's freedom," Dehradun SSP said.

299.title: We will win the ODI series 2-1 against India: Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia
299.article_body: Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia has predicted that they'll win the three-match ODI series against India 2-1. "We [will] win the series. As for personal expectations, I want to be the leading run scorer and score hundreds," stated Kaia. Zimbabwe recently registered wins against Bangladesh in both T20I and ODI series. The ODI series against India will begin on August 18.

300.title: Hyderabad Traffic Police transports live heart in 35 mins via green channel
300.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police facilitated transport of a live heart via 'green channel' from Somajiguda to Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in 35 minutes. The process began at 1 pm from Yashoda Hospital in Somajiguda and was transported to Shamshabad at 1:35 pm. This year alone, Hyderabad Police facilitated organ transport 25 times through green channels.

301.title: Gujarat riots, Mughal courts to be taught in Kerala schools: Report
301.article_body: Kerala schools are likely to introduce portions of the Gujarat riots and Mughal era in their curriculum, as per a report. These sections were dropped from class 12 textbooks by the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT). After NCERT removed some sections, Kerala SCERT conducted an exercise to see if those sections can be taught in the state.

302.title: Security beefed up in J&K ahead of Independence Day
302.article_body: Security has been beefed up across J&K to ensure safety of citizens during the Independence Day celebrations. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha will take part in the function at Sher-e-Kashmir Stadium in Srinagar on Monday. "Drones are being used. Patrolling is on. Covert and overt surveillance is also on. We are confident that the celebrations would go smoothly," said Baramulla SSP.

303.title: Everyone is upset: Barca manager Xavi on 0-0 draw in La Liga opener
303.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi Hernandez said "everyone is upset" after their 0-0 draw against Rayo Vallecano in their La Liga opener. "We tried as much as we could but we lacked aim and effectiveness. Maybe the pressure and expectation got a little under our skin," added Xavi. Notably, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha both made their La Liga debuts in the match.

304.title: Pune Police conduct combing operation ahead of Independence Day
304.article_body: Pune Police conducted a combing operation ahead of the 76th Independence Day and ran a check on 3,381 history-sheeters. The operation started on Friday at 10pm and went on for three hours at all police stations in Pune. Police arrested 61 people for various crimes and recovered two pistols, cartridges and 35 sharp weapons from some of the accused.

305.title: DRDO counter-drone system deployed near Red Fort ahead of I-Day
305.article_body: A counter-drone system developed by DRDO has been deployed near the Red Fort in Delhi ahead of the 75th Independence Day celebration. The counter-drone system can detect and deactivate drones of any size within a radius of around 4 km, DRDO officials said. Around 1,000 high-specification cameras will also be reportedly installed in the national capital to contain aerial objects.

306.title: Lifeguard saves Mumbai man, his son from drowning in Andamans
306.article_body: An alert lifeguard saved a Mumbai man and his son from drowning at the popular Radhanagar Beach in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, officials said on Sunday. The father-son duo from Mumbai was on a trip to the islands, they said, adding that the two got caught in a current and started to drown, following which the lifeguard saved them.

307.title: Bitcoin trades above $25,000 for the first time in two months
307.article_body: Bitcoin on Sunday surpassed the $25,000 level for the first time in two months. The world's largest cryptocurrency gained 1.6% to trade at $24,882 around 4 am New York time after rising over 2% to trade above the $25,000 mark. Bitcoin is still down 46.5% year-to-date. Meanwhile, Ethereum was up about 1% at $2,011.47 on Sunday.

308.title: Vijay Sethupathi's publicist denies actor's involvement in 'Pushpa 2'
308.article_body: Actor Vijay Sethupathi's publicist has refuted the reports that said that the actor will play a negative role in 'Pushpa 2'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Vijay isn't playing a negative role in any other Telugu projects as is being speculated." He confirmed Vijay will play a negative role in Atlee and Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan'.

309.title: BJP was 'untouchable' party before 1995, Nitish came to its rescue: Kushwaha
309.article_body: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha reacted to BJP leader's "Nitish Kumar should be grateful to BJP" remark and said that BJP was considered an "untouchable" party before 1995-96 as no political party wanted to associate themselves with them. Leaders of the Samata Party George Fernandes and Nitish Kumar came to the BJP's rescue "like angels", Kushwaha added.

310.title: Policeman arrested for taking bribe of ₹5,000 in Pune
310.article_body: A police constable in Pune was arrested by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for taking a bribe of ₹5,000. Vijay Eknath Shinde was taking a bribe from a person against whom the police had initiated preventive legal proceedings. A complainant informed ACB's Pune unit that Shinde demanded a bribe in connection with the preventive legal proceedings initiated against him.

311.title: Woman stabs live-in partner in B'luru over 'petty quarrel'; arrested
311.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stabbing her live-in partner to death over a petty quarrel, police said on Sunday. The incident took place in Bengaluru's Krishna Layout on Saturday when the victim questioned the accused over her mobile phone chats. After being stabbed in the neck and chest, the victim managed to run out of the house.

312.title: 10 Russian planes stuck in Germany due to EU sanctions: Report
312.article_body: At least 10 Russian planes are stuck in Germany amid EU sanctions imposed over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, news agency RedaktionsNetzwerk Deutschland reported citing Germany's ministry of transport. "Since the planes are subject to a take-off and flight ban due to...EU sanctions regime, they cannot be used by the owner and cannot be taken to another location," the ministry said.

313.title: Scotland to be 1st country to ensure access to free sanitary products
313.article_body: Scotland will become the first country in the world to protect the right to access free sanitary products with a new law that will be adopted on Monday. Under new legislation, local officials and education providers will be legally required to provide products for free to anyone in need. Additionally, government has allocated funding for menstrual health resources at institutions.

314.title: This is totally unacceptable: Kerala Guv on Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark
314.article_body: Following CPI(M)-backed independent Kerala MLA KT Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark, Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said this is totally "unacceptable". "I feel sorry for these kinds of comments…when we're celebrating 75th year of Independence…I feel hurt by these kinds of comments," Khan added. Earlier, Union Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Jaleel over his remark.

315.title: Thief uses phone, butcher's knife to steal ₹25,000 from shop in Hyd
315.article_body: A burglar used his mobile phone and a butcher's knife to steal ₹25,000 from a meat shop in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills on Friday night. The accused entered the shop after breaking the side door's lock and used his phone's torch and a butcher's knife to steal the aforementioned amount from three drawers in the shop.

316.title: Woman arrested for slapping e-rickshaw driver 17 times in Noida
316.article_body: A woman was arrested by the police on Saturday for allegedly slapping an e-rickshaw driver 17 times in Noida. The incident occurred on Friday when the accused assaulted the victim after the latter's e-rickshaw dented her car. The accused hails from Delhi and was arrested from her residence in Noida's Sector 110, a Noida Phase 2 Police Station official said.

317.title: Mali PM Maiga placed on 'forced rest' by doctor, his office says
317.article_body: Mali PM Choguel Kokalla Maiga has been placed on "forced rest" by his doctor after he worked for 14 months without a break, Maiga's office said in a statement on Saturday. Maiga would resume his activities after a week, the statement added. An adviser also denied media reports claiming that Maiga had suffered a stroke and is hospitalised, Reuters reported.

318.title: Was sporting, challenging for me to work with Vijay in 'Liger': Vish
318.article_body: Debutant Vish, who will play the lead antagonist in the film 'Liger', has said that it was "amazing" to work with actor Vijay Deverakonda. "It was very sporting and challenging for me to share screen space with him," he added. Vish further stated that he and Vijay come from the same city and have a lot of things in common.

319.title: Amitabh Bachchan sends audio message to ailing Raju Srivastava
319.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan sent an audio message to ailing comedian Raju Srivastava, wishing him a speedy recovery. In the audio message, Bachchan said, "It's enough Raju. Rise up Raju, and keep teaching us all to laugh." Raju was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi on Wednesday after suffering a heart attack.

320.title: Man electrocuted while trying to hoist Tricolour over shop in MP
320.article_body: A 45-year-old man died of electrocution while attempting to hoist a Tricolour over a shop in MP's Khargone, police said on Sunday. The deceased was trying to hoist the Tricolour over an iron rod, which came in contact with the power supply over the roof of a building, Barwaha police station in-charge Prakash Vaskale said.

321.title: PCMC to appoint transgender persons to collect taxes from residents
321.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has decided to appoint members of the transgender community to help in collecting taxes from residents. They will be appointed over a period of three months and may be given extensions on the basis of their performance, PCMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh said. Earlier, PCMC also appointed transgender persons as security guards.

322.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie should be a wake-up call on Iran: Rishi Sunak
322.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak has said, "The brutal stabbing of Salman Rushdie should be a wake-up call for the West, and Iran's reaction to the attack strengthens the case for proscribing the IRGC (Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps)." There has been no official government reaction in Iran to the attack on Rushdie, but several hardline Iranian newspapers praised his assailant.

323.title: Babar Azam conferred with Pakistan's 3rd highest civilian award
323.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has been conferred with Sitara-e-Pakistan, their third-highest civilian award, on the 75th Independence Day of Pakistan. Pakistan Women's captain Bismah Maroof has been conferred with their fourth-highest civilian honour, Tamgha-e-Pakistan. Babar is currently the top-ranked batter in ODI and T20I cricket and is placed third in the longest format of the game.

324.title: Poster of Tipu Sultan put up by Congress torn by miscreants in B'luru
324.article_body: A poster featuring Tipu Sultan put up by Karnataka Congress ahead of Independence Day at Hudson Circle in Bengaluru was vandalised by miscreants on Saturday night. The party has put up posters with pictures of different freedom fighters. Karnataka Congress Chief DK Shivakumar, who visited the incident spot, said that someone is trying to create disturbance in the state.

325.title: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen gifts boxing gloves to PM Modi, shares pics
325.article_body: Nikhat Zareen, who bagged a gold medal at CWG 2022, gifted boxing gloves signed by all the Indian pugilists who participated in CWG 2022 to PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Sharing pictures on Twitter, the 26-year-old wrote, "Thank you for this amazing opportunity...A great day spent with my fellow athletes who have made the country proud."

326.title: Stalker harasses table tennis player Naina Jaiswal online using multiple accounts, held
326.article_body: A stalker has been arrested by police in Hyderabad for harassing 22-year-old table tennis player Naina Jaiswal online using multiple social media accounts. The arrest was made after Naina's father filed a complaint with Central Crime Station (CCS). Naina's father claimed that the stalker would make new accounts after getting blocked and would continue to harass her.

327.title: He's like a son I never had: Martha on rumour of dating Pete Davidson
327.article_body: Martha Stewart has reacted to a rumour that suggested that she and Pete Davidson are dating. "Pete is like the son I never had. He is a charming boy who is finding his way," she added. This comes after Pete reportedly broke up with Kim Kardashian. Kim and Pete had made their relationship official earlier this year.

328.title: Had I been picked by RCB for IPL 2011, I would've had a longer IPL career: Taylor
328.article_body: Ex-NZ cricketer Ross Taylor has said that he probably would've had a longer IPL career had he been retained by RCB for a fourth consecutive season in 2011. Taylor started his IPL career with RCB in 2008 but moved to RR ahead of the 2011 season. "While the IPL is pretty unsentimental, there is loyalty towards long-serving players," stated Taylor.

329.title: Arunachal Pradesh CM praises auto drivers' 'Freedom ride', says 'I'm in awe'
329.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu took to Twitter to praise two auto rickshaw drivers for offering free rides on occasion of Independence Day. "I'm in absolute awe of auto rickshaw drivers, Moina Bhai and Marto Zirdo, who have announced free ride, or shall I say Freedom Ride, from Ganga Market to Mithun Gate, Itanagar to celebrate #AzadiKaAmritMahotsav," Khandu tweeted.

330.title: Bihar's political experiment to meet same fate as 'chacha-bhatija' in UP: BJP
330.article_body: The countdown for Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's "political exile" has begun, with the JD(U) and RJD joining hands in the state, BJP leader Dinesh Sharma has said. He further said that Bihar will witness a repetition of the unsuccessful "chacha-bhatija" and "bua-bhatija" partnerships in UP. Nitish Kumar took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on August 10.

331.title: College student stabbed to death in B'luru after clash with senior
331.article_body: An 18-year-old college student was stabbed to death on Friday near Bengaluru's HBR layout area after a clash between him and his senior. Preliminary investigation has revealed that the victim and the accused had challenged each other during a college fest a few days ago. The victim's friend was also attacked when he tried to save the victim.

332.title: Indo-American pair of Sania-Madison loses in National Bank Open semis
332.article_body: Sania Mirza and her partner Madison Keys crashed out of National Bank Open after losing in women's doubles semi-final in Toronto on Saturday. The Indo-American pair lost to the all-American duo of Coco Gauff and Jessie Pegula 5-7, 5-7 in one hour 17 minutes. Third-seeded Gauff and Pegula will face unseeded pair of Ellen Perez and Nicole Melichar-Martinez in final.

333.title: B'luru acid attack victim's family seeks govt help for plastic surgeries
333.article_body: The family of a 23-year-old acid attack victim in Bengaluru has urged the Karnataka government to extend its support and help her with the plastic surgeries. The woman, who was discharged from a hospital on Friday, had suffered 36% burn injuries and had undergone 27 surgeries. Her hospital bill came up to ₹40 lakh and it was claimed through ESI.

334.title: B'luru gets new electric buses with vehicle tracking units, panic buttons
334.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai flagged off 75 new electric buses of the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) today in front of Vidhana Soudha. The new buses, with seating capacity of 40 people, have vehicle tracking units, CCTV cameras, LED lights and emergency panic buttons for the safety of commuters. Notably, BMTC will complete 25 years of formation tomorrow.

335.title: Avoid going near banks of Yamuna: Delhi CM amid water level rise
335.article_body: Amid a rise in the water level of the Yamuna river in North Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday appealed to residents to avoid going near the banks of the river. "We've made adequate arrangements for...people living near Yamuna [river]. Cooperate with the government and administration," Kejriwal tweeted. The water level in the Yamuna river is currently 204.91 meters.

336.title: Punjab Police bust Pak-backed terror module; 3 hand-grenades, 40 live cartridges found
336.article_body: Punjab Police has busted a Pakistan-ISI-backed terror module with help of Delhi Police ahead of Independence day. Four module members associated with Canada-based Arsh Dalla and Australia-based Gurjant Singh have been arrested. Three hand-grenades, one IED, two nine mm pistols and 40 live cartridges have been recovered, DGP Punjab Police said.

337.title: Jhunjhunwala will remain inspiration for generations of young investors: Assam CM
337.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday condoled the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "Deeply saddened by the sudden demise of prominent investor and industrialist...He has left a legacy in the arena of stockbroking and will remain an inspiration for generations of young investors and entrepreneurs," Assam CM added. "My condolences to the bereaved family," he stated.

338.title: Car with 4 family members catches fire in Pune, no one injured
338.article_body: A car carrying four family members, including two children, caught fire and was gutted entirely in Pune's New Katraj Tunnel on Sunday morning. No one was injured as the incident occurred within a few moments after the family came out of their car as they saw smoke from its engine. The family was travelling towards Satara.

339.title: Future of Afghan women, girls bleak if nothing is done: UN experts
339.article_body: UN experts in a statement have warned that the future of women and girls in Afghanistan is "bleak" if nothing is done to change the "deteriorating" human rights situation there. "The international community must...step up efforts to urge de facto authorities to adhere to basic human rights principles," the statement said. Press freedom has also been suppressed, the statement added.

340.title: Was replaced with actress who was popular in her heydays: Neena Gupta
340.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta has said that even today, some filmmakers prefer to cast a popular yesteryear actress instead of her. She remembered that once she was offered a film but soon she was replaced by "another actress who was a bigger name in her heydays". Neena had previously admitted that she was jealous of Shabana Azmi in her young days.

341.title: Truck collides with passenger bus in Pakistan; 13 dead, 5 injured
341.article_body: At least 13 people were killed and five others were injured after a sugarcane-laden truck collided with a passenger bus in Rahim Yar Khan in Pakistan's Punjab on Saturday, officials said. The officials added that rainwater had accumulated on the road and the "bus got buried under the sugarcane sacks". The truck driver reportedly escaped from the scene.

342.title: Don’t stress over what you cannot control: Pant after Urvashi's 'chotu bhaiya' comment
342.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant took to Instagram Stories to share a quote amid controversy with Urvashi Rautela. "Don’t stress over what you cannot control," the quote read. Earlier, Urvashi had called Pant a "cougar hunter" and had remarked "Chotu bhaiyaa should play bat ball" after the cricketer said, "Leave me alone, sister". Pant's remark came in response to Urvashi's viral interview.

343.title: India observes Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, PM pays homage to victims
343.article_body: As India observed Partition Horrors Remembrance Day on Sunday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to pay homage to victims. "Today, on Partition Horrors Remembrance Day...I pay homage to all those who lost their lives during Partition...and applaud resilience as well as grit of all those who suffered during that tragic period of our history," the Prime Minister tweeted.

344.title: Robbers lock Fedbank staff in toilet in Chennai; loot gold and money worth ₹20 crore
344.article_body: Three armed robbers looted 32 kg gold and other valuables from branch of Fedbank Financial Services Ltd (Fedfina) in Chennai on Saturday. Preliminary investigation revealed that money and gold jewellery worth around ₹20 crore was stolen. Robbers allegedly tied employees to chairs and locked them in toilet. "Four special teams have been formed and they are currently investigating," Police said.

345.title: Toilet brush, mops hang above pizza dough in Domino's B'luru, Twitter user shares pics
345.article_body: A Twitter user shared purported photos from a Domino’s outlet in Bengaluru wherein cleaning mops were hanging above trays of pizza dough. In the two photos, a toilet brush, mops and clothes could be seen hanging on the wall and under them were placed the dough trays. Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Never eating at Domino's again."

346.title: Neobanking firm Fi raises $17 mn in Series C funding round: Report
