346.article_body: Bengaluru-based neobanking firm Fi has secured $15 million from Singapore's state-owned Temasek Holdings and $2 million from existing investor QCM Holdings in Series C funding round, as per regulatory filings. In June, the startup raised $45 million from Alpha Wave Global. The fundraise comes as digital lending apps grapple with RBI's lending rules which push for greater transparency.

347.title: Railways plans to add more Vistadome coaches on Mumbai-Goa route train
347.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) is planning to attach one more Vistadome coach to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT)-Madgaon Tejas Express, one of the premium trains on the Mumbai-Goa route, before this year-end, a senior railway official said. "These coaches with glass rooftops and wide window panes have proved to be a hit," CR's chief Public Relations Officer said.

348.title: Moving forward as one is something world can learn from India: RSS chief
348.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said moving forward as one is something that the world can learn from India. "We might look different. We might eat different things but there's unity in the existence," Bhagwat added. "Take a pledge to work for society and the country...Life should be dedicated to India," he said at 'Uttishtha Bharat' event in Nagpur.

349.title: Truss leads race for UK's next PM by 22 points against Sunak: Survey
349.article_body: An opinion poll conducted by Opinium Research showed UK's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss is 22 percentage points ahead of her rival and UK's former Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak in the race to become the next Prime Minister. Among a sample of 450 party members who had decided how they would vote, 61% favoured Truss while 39% favoured Sunak.

350.title: Jadeja will play in T20 WC 2022, but will not give you many wickets: Aakash
350.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja will definitely play in the upcoming T20 World Cup but will not pick "many wickets" in the tournament. "The mirror does not lie...he has played seven matches since the 2021 T20 World Cup, picked up just four wickets, average is above 43 and the economy is also close to 8.5," explained Aakash.

351.title: BJP to observe 'Partition Horrors Remembrance Day'
351.article_body: The BJP will organise silent marches across the country to observe the "Partition Horrors Remembrance Day" today to remind the nation of sacrifices of Indians during partition. Party national chief JP Nadda will also be taking part in the silent march in Delhi's Jantar Mantar. The leaders will also meet the relatives of those who suffered during the 1947 partition.

352.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha leads 'Har Ghar Tiranga' rally in Srinagar
352.article_body: As part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav', the troops of BSF organised a Tiranga rally, which was led by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha in Srinagar on Sunday. The official journey of the campaign began on March 12, 2021, which started a 75-week countdown to India's 75th anniversary of Independence. It aims to encourage people to hoist the Tricolour.

353.title: Floods triggered by seasonal rains leave 50 dead in Sudan: Official
353.article_body: Floods triggered by seasonal rainfall have left over 50 people dead and inundated over 8,170 homes in Sudan, a senior police official said on Saturday. Sudan's National Council for Civil Defense spokesperson said that about 25 people were also injured so far this year, SUNA news agency reported. About 540 feddans (acres) of agricultural land was damaged, the spokesperson added.

354.title: Rohit backed Avesh even after four failures and the pacer delivered: Parthiv
354.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said India captain Rohit Sharma stands out in backing players who sometimes don't perform. "Rohit is vocal about them even in public and in press conferences...as we saw with the case of Avesh Khan. Rohit backed him even after four failures [during India's tour of WI] and [Avesh] delivered with a Man-of-the-Match performance," stated Parthiv.

355.title: Ukraine targeting Russians shooting at or from nuclear plant: Zelenskyy
355.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian soldiers who either shoot at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, or shoot using it as cover become a special target for Ukraine's intelligence agents. Ukraine accused Russia of hitting part of the plant which generates power for the southern Ukraine. The two sides have accused each other of carrying out shelling at the nuclear facility.

356.title: Salman Rushdie's stab wounds listed in court after attack on him in New York
356.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie suffered three stab wounds to the right side of the front of his neck, four stab wounds to his stomach, a puncture wound to his right eye and chest, and a laceration on his right thigh, according to the Chautauqua County District attorney. Rushdie was attacked in New York on Friday, after which he underwent a surgery.

357.title: Billionaire investor Jhunjhunwala began trading with ₹5,000 during his college days
357.article_body: Late veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala began trading when he was in college in 1985 with a sum of ₹5,000. While his father, who was an official in the Income Tax Department, told him not to ask him for money, Jhunjhunwala borrowed money from his brother's clients while promising them higher returns. His net worth later grew to $5 billion.

358.title: China to reopen Shanghai schools from Sept 1 with daily COVID testing
358.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai will reopen kindergartens, nurseries, primary, middle and high schools, which had been shut since mid-March due to the spread of COVID-19, on September 1. All teachers and students in the city will have to take nucleic acid tests every day before leaving campus. Shanghai, China's most populous city, reported five new local asymptomatic cases on Saturday.

359.title: What were the top holdings of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala?
359.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62 on Sunday, held a 4% stake in Titan Company worth ₹8,728 crore, making it his top holding in terms of value. Jhunjhunwala's major holdings include Star Health & Allied Insurance, Tata Motors, Fortis Healthcare and CRISIL, Moneycontrol reported. Jhunjhunwala had a net worth of more than ₹46,000 crore, as per Forbes.

360.title: Search operation on to trace 3 missing people in UP’s Banda
360.article_body: Rescue and search operation is on for three missing people in UP’s Banda district where a boat capsized on August 11. A total of 12 bodies have been recovered so far. “NDRF, SDRF and police teams are carrying out rescue operations...The flow in the river is high which is creating problems in the operation,” Banda SP Abhinandan said.

361.title: Man fires shots at Canberra Airport in Australia, arrested
361.article_body: Australia's Canberra Airport was evacuated after a man fired shots on the premises on Sunday, the police said. The man has been taken into custody and the firearm has been recovered, the police added. "CCTV has been reviewed and at this time the person in custody is believed to be the only person responsible," the police further said.

362.title: 'Laal...' deserves to succeed, maybe bit too overstated emotionally: Hansal
362.article_body: On Twitter, filmmaker Hansal Mehta wrote that Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' deserves to succeed. "It's a very engaging film made with passion...love. Maybe a bit too overstated emotionally...a bit superficial politically for my taste but a film made with so much care, heart...honesty," he added. Hansal said he found himself moist-eyed or smiling for a major part of it.

363.title: Tata Tea Premium unveils #DeshKaGarv collection on 75th Independence Day
363.article_body: This Independence Day, Tata Tea Premium in collaboration with The Plated Project presents limited-edition #DeshKaGarv Art collection. With this, the brand aims to commemorate events from India’s past that contributed to her pride & glory globally. All proceeds from the collection purchased will be donated to sponsor meals for underprivileged children, enabling them to build a better future.

364.title: Never wanted the world to find out this way I called you Bhaiyya: Smriti on Jhunjhunwala
364.article_body: After billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's demise, Union Minister Smriti Irani wrote, "I never wanted the world to find out this way that I love you and called you Bhaiyya." "Since the day I was married, you never made me feel that I am to be treated like a daughter in law...I don't want to say goodbye," she added.

365.title: Info Edge invests ₹300 crore in its subsidiary Startup Investments
365.article_body: Noida-based IT firm Info Edge invested ₹300 crore in its fully-owned subsidiary Startup Investments (Holding) Limited (SIHL), the firm said in a regulatory filing. The capital will be used to explore other investment opportunities like contribution towards alternative investment funds (AIFs) managed by Info Edge-owned Smartweb Internet Services. Info Edge owns portals like Naukri and 99acres.

366.title: India has the 3rd largest startup ecosystem: Jitendra Singh
366.article_body: Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh said that India has the third largest startup ecosystem and the third highest number of unicorns. While delivering a keynote address, Singh mentioned that this decade is expected to bring transformational changes for Indian science, technology and innovation (STI). He also said that over 49% startups are from tier two and three cities.

367.title: 21-year-old youth booked after minor ends life in Ambala
367.article_body: Police arrested a 21-year-old college student in Ambala on charges of abetment to suicide after a 17-year-old girl died allegedly after consuming some poisonous substance. The deceased girl’s father, in his complaint, told the police that the youth and his daughter were in a relationship. He had promised to marry the girl but later backtracked, the complainant added.

368.title: Mumbai Police destroys 151 high-volume modified silencers of 2-wheelers
368.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Traffic Police crushed 151 seized modified high-volume silencers of two-wheelers with a road roller. Police said that modifying silencers with high volume is not permitted and many bikers install it for thrill. Strict action will also be taken against garage owners who install such silencers, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Purushottam Karad said.

369.title: After tremendous pressure, RSS finally changes profile pics to Tiranga: Khera
369.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera commented on RSS changing the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour. "After tremendous pressure for a week, a sheepish RSS finally changes profile pictures to Tiranga," Khera tweeted. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile picture to the national flag.

370.title: J'khand judge's murder shook judiciary, citizens; led to fear: Court
370.article_body: In the sentencing order regarding Judge Uttam Anand's murder in Jharkhand's Dhanbad, Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) Rajni Kant Pathak said that the incident shook the judicial fraternity and the citizens. "After the incident, there was an atmosphere of fear among the family members of judicial officers and the people of the country," the order said.

371.title: What an absolute blast: 'Baby Driver' director on Rajamouli's 'RRR'
371.article_body: 'Baby Driver' director Edgar Wright praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' on Twitter. "Finally saw 'RRR' on the big screen at the BFI with a great crowd. What an absolute blast. So entertaining," he tweeted. He further wrote, "The only film I've ever seen where the intermission card itself got a round of applause." The film featured Jr NTR and Ram Charan.

372.title: Rushdie's attacker pleads not guilty, his lawyer says 'People need to keep an open mind'
372.article_body: The man accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie has pleaded not guilty to charges of attempted murder and assault. The 24-year-old accused Hadi Matar's lawyer said, "I think the important thing to remember is people need to keep an open mind. They need to look at everything. They can't just assume something happened for why they think something happened."

373.title: Pluses & minuses aside, 'Laal Singh...' is magnificent: Hrithik Roshan
373.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Hrithik Roshan praised Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and wrote, "I felt the heart of this movie." "Just watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...Pluses and minuses aside, this movie is just magnificent," he further added. Calling 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a "gem", Hrithik urged people to watch the film. The film, directed by Advait Chandan, also features Kareena Kapoor.

374.title: US man drinks liquid in court during child sexual assault conviction, dies
374.article_body: A 57-year-old man died after he drank a bottle of liquid, which appeared to be cloudy, while being convicted of child abuse in court in US' Texas. The defence lawyer said that man started vomiting shortly after entering the holding cell, following which emergency services were called. The man's hand was "shaking", but he kept drinking, the defence lawyer added.

375.title: Man slits wife's throat inside family court after deciding to reunite in Karnataka
375.article_body: A man has been arrested in Karnataka's Hassan for allegedly killing his wife by slitting her throat inside a family court, where they had come for counselling after filing for divorce, police said. The accused had agreed to reunite with her during the counselling and attacked her in the court's restroom. He tried to escape but was caught by people.

376.title: My intent was not to victimise myself: CEO who posted crying selfie after firing staff
376.article_body: US-based HyperSocial’s CEO Braden Wallake, who posted a photo of himself crying on LinkedIn after firing employees, shared another post following criticism. He wrote, "I'm the crying CEO. No, my intent was not to make it about me or victimise myself. I'm sorry it came across that way. It wasn't my place to out the employees' names publicly."

377.title: Akasa Air issues statement after Jhunjhunwala's death, says 'Will honour his legacy'
377.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Sunday issued a statement after the death of the veteran investor. It said, "We are deeply saddened by the untimely demise of Mr Jhunjhunwala…We cannot thank [him] enough for...putting his trust...in us to build a world-class airline. [He] had an invincible spirit...Akasa Air will honour [his] legacy, values and belief in us".

378.title: Such pettiness: Congress to CM Bommai for 'Har Ghar...' ad without Nehru
378.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Karnataka CM BS Bommai insulted his father SR Bommai and his father's first political guru MN Roy, who were great Nehru admirers, by excluding Jawaharlal Nehru's photo from 'Har Ghar Tiranga' newspaper ad. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Nehru will survive such pettiness. CM Karnataka desperate to save his job...Pathetic this is."

379.title: It was shocking for me: Aakash on Chahal missing T20 WC last year
379.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said that he was "shocked" when Yuzvendra Chahal was not named in India's squad for the T20 World Cup last year. Aakash added that the 32-year-old is "definitely going to Australia" for the upcoming T20 World Cup. He further said, "Chahal is the number one genuine wicket-taker that [we] have."

380.title: Scindia to celebrate ‘Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav’ in Gwalior
380.article_body: As part of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate photo exhibition and preside over various programmes at Maharani Lakshmi Bai Ki Chhatri and Central Jail in Gwalior today. He will also observe ‘Partition Horrors Remembrance Day’ to remind the nation of the sacrifices made by Indians during the partition in 1947.

381.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala died of cardiac arrest, was suffering from multiple ailments
381.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala passed away at the age of 62 after suffering a cardiac arrest, as per the death certificate issued. Notably, Jhunjhunwala had been suffering from multiple ailments, including kidney disease and ischemic heart disease and was brought dead to Breach Candy Hospital around 6.45 am on Sunday. He will be cremated today evening in Mumbai.

382.title: Ram Janmbhoomi temple hoists national flag in Ayodhya
382.article_body: As part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, the national flag was hoisted at the Ram Janmbhoomi temple complex in Ayodhya. Participating in this campaign were the officers and staff of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra trust, including the construction workers. The campaign aims to encourage people to hoist the flag to mark the 75th year of India’s independence.

383.title: Police taser parents trying to enter school under lockdown in US
383.article_body: The police arrested three parents and tasered two of them after they tried to enter a school in US' Arizona, which was under lockdown following reports of a male suspect carrying a handgun attempting to get on campus. The incident occurred as parents tried to forcefully enter the buildings, police said. The suspect has been taken into custody, police added.

384.title: Jhunjhunwala symbol of entrepreneurial spirit, will be remembered for Akasa Air: Scindia
384.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia on Sunday said that billionaire investor and Akasa Air co-founder Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was a symbol of India's entrepreneurial spirit and will remain an inspiration for the youth of the country. Scindia added, "He will be remembered for giving India its new airline Akasa Air after more than a decade."

385.title: You have to give Dhawan importance: Karim on captaincy change
385.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul replacing Shikhar Dhawan as India captain for the ODI series against Zimbabwe, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said, "You have to give Dhawan importance once you make the announcement as captain." He added, "Rahul should have played the series only as a member." Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has been named Rahul's deputy for the series.

386.title: Jhunjhunwala was my school mate, believed stock India was undervalued: Kotak
386.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak expressed his condolences after the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Kotak said Jhunjhunwala was his school and college mate and a year junior to him. "[He] believed stock India was undervalued. He was right. Amazingly sharp in understanding financial markets," Kotak tweeted. Both Kotak and Jhunjhunwala graduated from Mumbai's Sydenham College.

387.title: Kalam's dream of India becoming superpower to be realised by 2047: Union Minister
387.article_body: Union Minister L Murugan on Saturday said that under PM Narendra Modi's governance, the country is moving towards the path of becoming a superpower in the global arena. "The dream of former President APJ Abdul Kalam [of] making India a superpower would be realised by 2047 when the country celebrates its 100th year of independence," Murugan added.

388.title: Varun Dhawan meets Indian cricket team, says 'Was like boy in candy shop'
388.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan met the Indian cricket team at the Mumbai airport. Varun took to Twitter and shared pictures with the team. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "At four in the morning, I was like a boy in a candy shop. Got very excited to meet and chat with our men in blue about their upcoming tour," Varun tweeted.

389.title: Rajasthan CM assures speedy probe after Dalit boy's death, announces ₹5 lakh for family
389.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death by his teacher for drinking water from his pot in Rajasthan's Jalore, state Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that justice will be ensured to the family of the victim at the earliest. The Chief Minister added that an assistance amount of ₹5 lakh will be given to the family of deceased.

390.title: IAS officer shares pic of Tricolour face masks, says 'please don't buy such masks'
390.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a picture of face masks made out of the Tricolour. "Please do not make, buy or use such masks," he wrote. Several Twitter users criticised such masks, with one saying, "It's better to find out makers of this mask & launch FIR for disrespect of our flag."

391.title: Want to do roles that aren't me like Rani Bharti of 'Maharani': Huma
391.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, speaking about the current phase of her acting career after featuring in the 'Maharani' series, said she's having fun. "Being a hardcore Delhi girl, I have certain life...experiences but I want to do roles that aren't me such as Rani Bharti of 'Maharani'," she added. She stated she is "nowhere" close to Rani Bharti in real life.

392.title: He was an institution by himself: K'taka CM pays tribute to Jhunjhunwala
392.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took to social media to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "Shocked and saddened by the untimely demise of ace stock trader and investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala this morning. A role model for many young investors, he was an institution by himself. May his soul rest in peace," he tweeted.

393.title: Breaks my heart to know my friend is no more: Vedanta chief on Jhunjhunwala's death
393.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday tweeted a photo of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala while condoling his death. Agarwal wrote, "Breaks my heart to know that a friend of mine, and more widely known as the big bull of our stock market, is no more…Rakesh Jhunjhunwala will forever be known as the man who popularised public understanding of stock markets."

394.title: Let's see film on Poo someday, she's relevant with this generation: Kareena
394.article_body: Kareena Kapoor has said her 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' character Poo is relevant to the current generation. "The way she is, the way she talks, the kind of millennial Gen-Z kind of words that she uses connect somehow...Let's see a film someday, who knows," she added. 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' was directed by Karan Johar and featured Shah Rukh Khan.

395.title: SP's Maurya sends ₹11.50 cr defamation notice to Noida Police chief
395.article_body: SP leader Swami Prasad Maurya claimed to have sent a defamation notice to GB Nagar Police Commissioner for linking him to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting and abusing a woman in Noida. Maurya has sought ₹11.50 crore as general and special compensation for loss of reputation and family honour, mental torture and physical agony.

396.title: Kamath posts pic with Jhunjhunwala, says 'There'll never be someone like you'
396.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath condoled the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62. Sharing a picture with him on Twitter, Kamath wrote, "There will never again be someone like you, RIP." Jhunjhunwala, who was reportedly suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, was brought dead to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital on Sunday morning.

397.title: 9-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death by teacher for drinking water from his pot in Raj
397.article_body: A nine-year-old Dalit boy in Rajasthan's Jalore district died on Saturday after he was allegedly beaten by his school teacher for drinking water from his pot. "My son didn't know that the pot was meant for [teacher Chail] Singh, who belongs to an upper caste," the boy's father said. A case has been registered under SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

398.title: Investor, risk taker & a leader in his own right: Sitharaman on Jhunjhunwala's death
398.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman took to Twitter to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. She tweeted, "Shri Rakesh Jhunjhunwala is no more. Investor, bold risk taker, masterly understanding of the stock market, clear in communication- a leader in his own right. Fondly remember several conversations we had. Had strong belief in India's strength and capabilities."

399.title: Jhunjhunwala inspired investors, he will be remembered for his bullish outlook: Shah
399.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday tweeted, "Anguished to learn about the passing away of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala Ji. His vast experience and understanding of the stock market have inspired countless investors." The minister added, "He will always be remembered for his bullish outlook. My deepest condolences to his family. Om Shanti Shanti."

400.title: Security in place for flag hoisting at Idgah Maidan: Bengaluru Police
400.article_body: After Karnataka government asked police to hoist national flag at Idgah Maidan, the Bengaluru Police Commissioner said that all security arrangements have been made for Independence Day celebration and if situation demands, additional forces will be deployed. "We have deployed a KSRP battalion, a police inspector and 10 police constables," Additional Commissioner of Police Sandeep Patil said.

401.title: Adani condoles Jhunjhunwala's death, calls him India's 'most legendary investor'
401.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani condoled the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Adani tweeted, "Extremely saddened by the untimely passing away of the most legendary investor that India has had. Shri Jhunjhunwala inspired an entire generation to believe in our equity markets with his brilliant views." Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

402.title: 15 people injured after car crashes into a pub in US' Virginia
402.article_body: Nine people were taken to hospitals and six others were treated on the scene after a car crashed into a pub in Arlington in US' Virginia, according to authorities. The crash also caused a fire to break out, which was quickly extinguished by the fire department, police said. Two of the injured people are in critical condition, the police added.

403.title: People live on roadside in Delhi as Yamuna water enters low-lying areas
403.article_body: Several people resorted to living on the roadside in Delhi after overflowing water from the Yamuna river inundated low-lying areas, news agency ANI reported. Reports said that low-lying areas near Mayur Vihar Phase I and Akshardham Temple were flooded due to the overflowing Yamuna river. "The water came gushing in...I immediately rushed to evacuate my family members," a woman said.

404.title: End of an era as the 'Big Bull of the Dalal Street' passes away: Virender Sehwag
404.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to condole the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. He tweeted, "End of an era as the Big Bull of the Dalal Street passes away. Condolences to his family and loved ones. Om Shanti." Jhunjhunwala, who was suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, passed away aged 62 on Sunday.
